story: 8***

We have completed the 1st Indiegogo round successfully. Thank you all. Backers have just been contacted with the 1st SurveyMonkey :) 

We're making an pro camera for your iPhone 5! Make shooting a great photo as simple as 1-2-3: slide in, shoot with the ladibird app and then share! Say goodbye to transferring memory cards, connecting cables and waiting for your friends to upload pictures to facebook!

Our appcessory allows you to share high-quality mirrorless images instantly with your friends and family through social network apps such as Facebook. You can:

  • Use filters with Instagram 
  • Share pics through email, MMS or chat apps
  • Instant editing through apps such as Photoshop Express
  • Instant backup/transfer to the cloud with apps such as Dropbox

 

We're building this because we believe smartphone photos ought to match DSLR image quality but without the extra weight, bulk or complexity. And we've figured out the best way to achieve this goal: merging great electronics and glass to your iPhone! 

 

As the team works on the prototype that will revolutionise digital photography we're taking this chance to do a small pre-order round of 500 units to assess demand at a very low early bird price: as low as $137!


This is our current solution for future iPhone models:

  • You pre-order a ladibird now
  • We deliver on June 30, 2014
  • If Apple releases iPhone 5S/5C at the end of 2013 
  • And you buy an iPhone 5S/5C
  • Please inform us immediately
  • We will ship you a ladibird that fits your iPhone 5S by June 30, 2014 (or Sept 30, 2014, if you buy a middle or late bird)

As for iPhone 6, it is expected to be released in June 2015. iPhones are released usually on an 18-month cycle period. Our plan is to eventually match that cycle period as well.

 

  • We will continue this project even if we do not reach our US$20,000 Indiegogo goal. 
  • Your money is kept separate from us developers and reserved purely for end-stage manufacturing. We are NOT using your pledge money to build any prototypes, travel expenses, salaries, etc. 
  • In the event we encounter an unforeseen technological bottleneck and ladibird cannot be completed, we will refund you your pledge. 

 

The heart of the ladibird is the CMOS image sensor, which is the key component of all digital cameras. 

The ladibird uses a mirrorless image sensor that is 7.5x bigger than your smartphone's camera sensor. This larger size gives the following benefits: 

  • Higher resolution pictures with far greater detail and sharpness
  • Increased sensitivity to low-light making it ideal for both indoor and night shoots

This sensor is only one half of the ladibird; the other half is our 50mm f/1.8 prime lens (35mm equivalent).

The main goal of the ladibird - to capture pictures of people with shallow depth of field or the blurred background a technique often used in cinematography or classic noir Hollywood photos.

In short, the ladibird take a picture that truly focuses on you!

Ladibird's 50mm (35mm equivalent) large aperture prime lens also:

  • Absorbs more light, allowing for natural lighting shots without flash
  • Captures richer, vibrant colours in photos
  • Has minimal distortion, thus your jaws, cheeks, chin and hips remain slim unlike photos of wide angle lenses such as smartphones and compact camera. You don't look fat - the camera just has the wrong lens for you!

   

1) The ladibird is only for iPhone 5 and onwards?

Yes, primarily due to 2 main reasons:

  • With the introduction of the iPhone 5, Apple changed the 30-pin port that used to be on the older models to the newer Lightning port.
  • We needed to consider manufacturing volume issues involved in keeping compatibility with the iPhone form factor upgrade cycle. In view of this factor, we are starting with iPhone 5 model onwards.  

 

2) Photos from such a big sensor would be quite large, in terms of megabytes. Will they be compressed before sharing out?

  • Yes, as the iPhone itself and several other apps compress images prior to sending them out.
  • The ladibird app will incorporate compression algorithms as well.

 

3) Will you be able to transmit the ladibird's images to the iphone separately through wireless tech such as WiFi or Bluetooth?

  • We will look at these possibilities but the ladibird is currently designed to transmit through the Lightning port only.
  • Any form of wireless connectivity to will be an added feature, we are currently concentrating our efforts on ensuring ladibird works as a whole together with your iPhone 5. 

 

4) Can the ladibird record video? 

  • Yes. Since the mid-2000s, most image sensors in consumer products such as ladibird can record video.
  • We will update you on ladibird's video format, resolution, FPS and bit depth in future.  

 

5) What is the megapixel count of the ladibird?

  • We cannot reveal the megapixel count as yet due to NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement). 

 

6) What about flash? I don't see a flash anywhere on the ladibird!

Many people actually prefer to take pictures without on-camera flash because:

  • You look extremely washed out and your skin pores become highly visible due to the direct flash.
  • Your own body casts very harsh shadows into the background, creating areas of darkness in the photo.
  • Check out OKCupid's study, which finds flash tends to make you 7 years older in photos: http://blog.okcupid.com/index.php/dont-be-ugly-by-accident/

We are looking into building a flash system that can avoid all of the above. More details will be revealed in future. 

 

7) Your project is going for 2 rounds of crowdfunding. Why are you doing this and what happens if you cannot finish the project?

  • We are treating this first round of Indiegogo as a prototype round. Our second round of Indiegogo, expected by end of 2013 or Q1 2014, will be the real crowdsourcing event for mass production. 
  • At any stage if we are unable to continue, we will refund you your pledged amount. However the key components have been confirmed, our team is mature (with combined 20 years of working experience) and we also have business continuity plans in place to ensure the project gets completed.  

 

8) Why are you not on Kickstarter?

  • Kickstarter is open only to American or British citizens, thus we do not qualify.

 

9) We are your first backers on Indiegogo. What will you use our money for? 

We will use your pledge money to:

  • Manufacture the first production batch. Your pledge will be kept aside strictly only for the first production batch. We will NOT be using your money to build the prototypes.   
  • If you reside in Singapore, Hong Kong or Taipei, you will get also have  a chance to be our beta tester. We will try to get a balanced pool of beta testers based on gender, age groups and user types such as DSLR owners, Instagrammers, casual smartphone users, bloggers etc. 

Also, as we want to ensure ladibird is built with your needs in mind, we will occasionally send you a SurveyMonkey (an email survey service) to help us on key development decisions.   

10) How can we verify you are genuinely doing this project?

  • If you're in Singapore, you can find us, talk to us and even drop by to visit us if you wish, we'd be quite happy to have a chat with you. We're a startup kindly housed in the National University of Singapore.
  • We also have the Made for iPhone (MFi) development license and are ready to work on the base development hardware with our key component manufacturer.
  • If you're from Taipei, you can also arrange to meet us. All backers will be updated with our travel plans. We will also be collaborating with an institution in Taipei.

If you are from any other part of the world, you can skype and chat us up on facebook or email us directly. Our timezone is GMT +8.00.

http://www.facebook.com/theladibird (most frequently updated)

https://twitter.com/theladibird (sharing of tech/camera/startup information here) 

http://ladibird.com (will be updated gradually of all specifications and features)

 

This is our team of 3:

Adam Latip

Ex-tech & ops bank executive. Photography enthusiast for 10 years, freelance photographer and commercial studio assistant for 1 year. Assistant for food products & car showroom photography. Prefers portraiture work. Designer & founder of the ladibird.   

Hansheng Chiu

Taiwanese ex-camera engineer, now doing his 2nd Master's here in NUS. Also a photo enthusiast with DSLR cameras. Met Adam in the Microsoft building in Singapore at a tech pitch event. Technical co-founder of the ladibird.

Surekha Yadav

Ex-television reporter/producer now in social media. We are proud to have her on the team because we believe tech space should have more representation from women. Public relations and media specialist.  

The portraits used here belong to 3 Singapore residents - Efa, Kar Hao and Sara. They were all shot along the Singapore River with a 50mm prime lens on a 12 megapixel Nikon D700 by Adam, to expand his photography portfolio in 2009. 

Thanks for reading :) Please like our facebook page and spread the word about us!

story:
Kristi's Latex Fantasy!

As you may know I have reached my goal of bigger breast implants and I am loving them! If you've been following my breast expansion journey on twitter, webcams, forums etc., I really hope you are loving it too. 

The one side effect of my new awesome increasing curves is that my latex attire no longer fits! Truly a tragedy because who doesn't love seeing extreme curves in skin tight curve hugging rubber?

My goal here is to fund a new latex wardrobe. Everything will be custom sized to ensure the tightest perfect fit possible. I'll be sure to share photos and wear the latex purchased with the fund live on webcams for you all to enjoy!

Donate & Receive

There are 5 different perk levels for this fundraising project.

Donate $25USD to receive: 2 downloadable short latex tease videos

Donate $50USD to receive: 5 downloadable short latex tease videos

Donate $75USD to receive: 1 signed one of a kind Polaroid photo in latex AND 5 downloadable short latex tease videos

Donate $250USD to receive:

  • 1 latex item that my bust is to big to fit in
  • 1 signed one of a kind Polaroid photo in that latex item
  • 1 signed one of a kind random Polaroid photo
  • 5 downloadable short latex tease videos

Donate $500USD to receive:

  • 1 full latex outfit/item that my bust is to big to fit in (with a new purchase value of between $200-370USD)
  • 1 signed one of a kind Polaroid photo in that latex outfit
  • 1 signed one of a kind random Polaroid photo
  • 5 downloadable short latex tease videos
  • 1 short latex tease video made just for you!

**Due to the polaroid photos being smaller than initially expected I will be sending 2 or 3 instead of just one for each indicated in the reward perks!**

Don't forget to share this page if you can't donate today!

Latex Shopping Cart

Here I will be updating as we go the items I plan to purchase with the project. Hopefully I will be able to include photo examples of each item. If you have a recommendation for a latex item you'd like to see me wearing email me at love.kristi.xo@gmail.com and let me know! Naturally I will consider donor recommendations more heavily.

With the funds from this project I intend to purchase... 

This sexy bodysuit w/ matching stockings from Rubber Eva in the shown colors.

This beautiful one of a kind dress by KinkyKex in blue/clear/purple/silver if possible.

A made to measure sexy black catsuit with a 3way zipper from Violaceous Latex.

...and more!

Don't forget to share this page if you can't donate today!

If for some reason you prefer to not have item(s) mailed to you email me at love.kristi.xo@gmail.com so I can email you the one of a kind latex photo(s) or we can arrange alternative rewards for the latex item/outfits.

Note to Indiegogo: I have read your terms of service and am in no way offering pornography or sexually explicit materials in my perks.

story:
Koda Lens Protector - Never Scratch Again

Protect your lenses once and for all. Pre-order yours today!


Koda Lens Protector

When it comes to scratched lenses, everybody has a story. Why? Glasses and sunglasses are more than just accessories. Whether you wear a five dollar pair of sunglasses that you found at a gas station in Oklahoma or a custom crafted prescription set made just for you, eyewear is more than just a product: it is a part of daily life. It’s easy to take for granted just how much we rely on our glasses and sunglasses until something happens.


For some, it’s a world brought to a screeching halt by the headaches and expense of a chipped prescription lens that takes days to replace. For others, it’s a lifetime of buyer’s remorse caused by their first trip to the beach or into the mountains with a brand new pair of $300 shades, only to return with a scratched lens that renders them useless. Whatever your story, the disappointment and frustration caused by a damaged lens will always be the same.


Let’s face it: life is too tough for a tiny little lens to handle all on its own. There's no relief even if you buy high-end eyewear because there is no difference in durability in the most vulnerable piece: the lens. Koda Lens Protector is on a mission to let you buy the glasses or sunglasses you want without having to wonder if they will last.


Never scratch again. Koda Lens Protector is a thin, high-tech film applied directly to the lens. It utilizes a patent pending design that conforms perfectly to the topography of the lens and that is simple enough for you to install right at home. Koda Lens Protector leverages a self-healing formula that leaves no residue and is invisible to the wearer, deflecting even the toughest curves life throws at your lenses.


We are on a mission to #savealltheglasses and will stop at nothing to get there. Contributors have a unique opportunity to be the first to own Koda Lens Protector for any pair of glasses or sunglasses. KLP is also excited to be teaming up with a local charity to bring needed prescription glasses to third-world children through our campaign. If we hit our goals, a pair of prescription glasses will be donated for every Koda Lens Protector ordered.


About Us

Koda Lens Protector (KLP) is the newest evolution in eyewear technology: an ultra-thin, self-healing film created to help defend consumer eyewear against the scratches caused by handling, dropping, or even simply cleaning lenses. The lens protector is placed directly onto the lens with an invisible adhesive and can be manufactured to conform seamlessly to the topography of any lens. Bearing the same industrial strength as high grade smartphone screen protectors with a thinner design, KLP provides aerospace gradedurability made to last as long as the eyewear itself. Application is simple - use the provided spray solution and applicator to seal - and removal is painless, leaving no residue or wear marks behind. KLP is the invisible solution perfect for lens wearers from every walk of life.


With over 40 supported manufacturers, KLP’s ability to match and protect essentially every model of eyewear on the market gives endless possibilities to this up and coming brand. Manufacturers ranging from sports performance brand Oakley to luxury brands such as Prada and Versace display a wide range of shapes that KLP can accommodate. Everyone from the occasional sunglass wearer to the eyeglass wearer dependent on their lens for vision can benefit from KLP.


After scratching an expensive pair of sunglasses only days after buying them, founder/inventor Matthew Baker scoured every corner of the internet looking for a product that he could use to prevent future scratches. “There wasn’t anything like this out there,” says Baker. “So I decided just to make it myself.” He left his family company in 2015 and set out to develop KLP as a way to end unnecessary lens damage, allowing those who (like himself) prefer the look and feel of designer eyewear but settle for cheaper options to avoid disappointment. “Nobody should have to pass up the eyewear they want just because they are worried about a scratch,” notes Baker. “And now, thanks to [KLP], they don’t have to.”


The greatest challenge in bringing his vision to life, Baker says, has been manufacturing. With thousands of variations of sunglasses and eyeglasses, designing a process that would accommodate the wide variety of eyewear on the market proved to be no easy task. Baker experimented with so many production methods he feared that his product would die as nothing more than an idea. It was at this point that he crossed paths with an engineer with extensive manufacturing experience that directed him to the high-tech hardware and advanced computer systems needed to not only handle the complex process of producing the lens protector itself, but also provide the flexibility needed to manufacture a wide range of lenses on-demand.


KLP has perfected its designs and is in the process of evaluating a shortlist of materials and factories to begin production. To cover the costs of the first production run Baker has launched an Indiegogo campaign with exciting rewards including a lifetime supply of protectors. Pre-order is available now.


How Koda Lens Protector Works

Those familiar with high-grade smartphone screen protectors will find many parallels in the design and functionality of Koda Lens Protector. The material is of aerospace grade durability and utilizes a self-healing formula to ensure that it will last as long as you keep your glasses or sunglasses.


Koda Lens Protector has been designed with the end-user in mind since day one. We have carefully crafted our product to be simple enough to install in your own home using the provided spray solution and applicator. The adhesive is fully transparent, providing invisible protection for your lenses.


So why not just buy a smartphone screen protector and apply it to your lenses yourself? There are two reasons that this will not work (trust us, we tried - this was actually how our initial prototype was born!), the first being the curvature of the lenses, and the second being the thickness of the material.


While smartphone screen protectors adhere flawlessly to the flat or simple curves of a wraparound smartphone screen, lenses are much more complex. The lens protectors must actually be manufactured specifically to form to the nuances of each specific lens to prevent bubbles and peeling from occuring.


Koda Lens Protector is also composed of a specially formulated material that is thinner than smartphone screen protectors. Thicker materials extend too far from the surface of the lens, causing them to peel up from the edges over time and collect dirt and debris under the edges (therefore defeating the purpose of the lens protector).


We are always happy to answer questions about our product, just drop us a comment in the campaign and we will get back to you right away!


The Budget

We are raising $57,000 so we can start the first round of production. The patent and engineering fees have already been paid out of pocket, so the funds will go straight to the materials, equipment, and programming needed to put this into action. The costs of production are heavily front-loaded, as the equipment is advanced and a significant amount of custom programming is required to prepare our lens library for production.

Once production begins, the ongoing costs are reduced dramatically. From that point forward the bulk of our cost will be the funding of a seamless customer service experience and the expansion of our physical network as we strive to provide local, in-person support to the greatest number of our customers as we can possibly reach.

Stretch Goals

While we can get Koda Lens Protector off the ground if we hit our funding goals, it will take a lot more to fulfill our mission to #savealltheglasses. The more funds we are able to raise, the more lenses we will be able to keep in our library and support through an expanded physical support network.

$83,000 - Free Koda Dog Microfiber Cloth for every campaign contributor

$175,000 - Lifetime warranty included free with every Koda Lens Protector

$335,000 - Second Koda Lens Protector free for all campaign contributors

Perks

A 2 year unlimited warranty is included with any purchase of KLP (unless we are able to hit our $175,000 stretch goal, which will automatically upgrade all KLP purchasers to a lifetime warranty).

  • $1  Email updates!

    • You, my friend, are 'Le Observer'. Drop a dollar in our pejorative hat and we will keep you updated on the latest and greatest developments taking place at Koda Lens Protector, including discounts, new products, future investment opportunities, and opportunities to connect with Koda Lens Protector in your area. Every dollar counts!

  • $5  Hand-signed photo of founder with Koda Dog

    • What could possibly be more nostalgic than a framed, hand-signed photo of our founder with the ACTUAL Koda dog on your wall? (frame not included) You will still receive the same insider updates as $1 contributors, you will just also get a completely awesome token by which you can remember the day that you did your part to help #savealltheglasses.

  • $9 KLP Catalog IGG Exclusive - First 100 Backers only!

    • Exclusive to our first 100 IndieGoGo backers: 50% off ANY Koda Lens Protector from our lens catalog (see description for list of supported manufacturers) AND enjoy preferred delivery at no additional cost - no orders can ship until yours has been delivered! Includes email updates and hand-signed photo of founder with Koda Dog mascot.

  • $18  Catalog - One Koda Lens Protector from lens library

    • Choose any Koda Lens Protector from the lens library - see below for a complete list. Includes insider emails and hand-signed photo of founder with Koda Dog mascot.

  • $26  Catalog Preferred - guaranteed first delivery

If we don't reach our goal, we will not stop in our quest to bring this vision to life. However, the production costs of Koda Lens Protector are largely front-loaded, meaning that we will have to divert the funds that would have gone to charity and secure additional funds through alternative channels. The most significant impact this will have will be on our timeline - if we fall short of our goal, we will be unable to guarantee that our timeline will stay intact.

Catalog

Koda Lens Protector includes current models for all of the following manufacturers in our product catalog:

We are always reviewing new lines for our catalog. Don’t see yours? Drop a comment in our campaign to let us know you want to see it added!

Timeline

September 2016 - Secure production facility and begin installing equipment

October 2016 - Begin programming lens library

November 2016 - Begin test production runs, refine prototypes for production

December 2016 - Finalize production models

January 2016 - Begin production

February 2016 - Begin deliveries

Thank you so much for checking us out, and we can’t wait to have you on board! Leave a comment in the campaign or drop us a message if you have any questions.



Risks & Challenges

Our lives have been dedicated to this project over the past 18+ months. The curvature of lenses can be very complex (especially with so many different lenses out there), but we have remained committed to finding an efficient, cost-effective way to produce Koda Lens Protector for all of them.

Our greatest challenges lie not in producing Koda Lens Protector (anymore), but in building an effective physical support network to provide a local reach to as many of our customers as possible and contribute to an exceptional sales and customer service experience for all of our users. While these functions can be performed remotely through a central facility, our commitment is to providing the most efficient, seamless customer experience possible. This can only be done if we can provide convenient, local access to all of our customers.

We know what we need to do - now we just need the funds to put it all in place and press the button to start manufacturing!

We will keep you posted on the progress through updates here on Indiegogo.
story_txt:
Koda Lens Protector - Never Scratch AgainProtect your lenses once and for all. Pre-order yours today!Koda Lens ProtectorWhen it comes to scratched lenses, everybody has a story. Why? Glasses and sunglasses are more than just accessories. Whether you wear a five dollar pair of sunglasses that you found at a gas station in Oklahoma or a custom crafted prescription set made just for you, eyewear is more than just a product: it is a part of daily life. It’s easy to take for granted just how much we rely on our glasses and sunglasses until something happens.For some, it’s a world brought to a screeching halt by the headaches and expense of a chipped prescription lens that takes days to replace. For others, it’s a lifetime of buyer’s remorse caused by their first trip to the beach or into the mountains with a brand new pair of $300 shades, only to return with a scratched lens that renders them useless. Whatever your story, the disappointment and frustration caused by a damaged lens will always be the same.Let’s face it: life is too tough for a tiny little lens to handle all on its own. There's no relief even if you buy high-end eyewear because there is no difference in durability in the most vulnerable piece: the lens. Koda Lens Protector is on a mission to let you buy the glasses or sunglasses you want without having to wonder if they will last.Never scratch again. Koda Lens Protector is a thin, high-tech film applied directly to the lens. It utilizes a patent pending design that conforms perfectly to the topography of the lens and that is simple enough for you to install right at home. Koda Lens Protector leverages a self-healing formula that leaves no residue and is invisible to the wearer, deflecting even the toughest curves life throws at your lenses.We are on a mission to #savealltheglasses and will stop at nothing to get there. Contributors have a unique opportunity to be the first to own Koda Lens Protector for any pair of glasses or sunglasses. KLP is also excited to be teaming up with a local charity to bring needed prescription glasses to third-world children through our campaign. If we hit our goals, a pair of prescription glasses will be donated for every Koda Lens Protector ordered.About UsKoda Lens Protector (KLP) is the newest evolution in eyewear technology: an ultra-thin, self-healing film created to help defend consumer eyewear against the scratches caused by handling, dropping, or even simply cleaning lenses. The lens protector is placed directly onto the lens with an invisible adhesive and can be manufactured to conform seamlessly to the topography of any lens. Bearing the same industrial strength as high grade smartphone screen protectors with a thinner design, KLP provides aerospace gradedurability made to last as long as the eyewear itself. Application is simple - use the provided spray solution and applicator to seal - and removal is painless, leaving no residue or wear marks behind. KLP is the invisible solution perfect for lens wearers from every walk of life.With over 40 supported manufacturers, KLP’s ability to match and protect essentially every model of eyewear on the market gives endless possibilities to this up and coming brand. Manufacturers ranging from sports performance brand Oakley to luxury brands such as Prada and Versace display a wide range of shapes that KLP can accommodate. Everyone from the occasional sunglass wearer to the eyeglass wearer dependent on their lens for vision can benefit from KLP. After scratching an expensive pair of sunglasses only days after buying them, founder/inventor Matthew Baker scoured every corner of the internet looking for a product that he could use to prevent future scratches. “There wasn’t anything like this out there,” says Baker. “So I decided just to make it myself.” He left his family company in 2015 and set out to develop KLP as a way to end unnecessary lens damage, allowing those who (like himself) prefer the look and feel of designer eyewear but settle for cheaper options to avoid disappointment. “Nobody should have to pass up the eyewear they want just because they are worried about a scratch,” notes Baker. “And now, thanks to [KLP], they don’t have to.”The greatest challenge in bringing his vision to life, Baker says, has been manufacturing. With thousands of variations of sunglasses and eyeglasses, designing a process that would accommodate the wide variety of eyewear on the market proved to be no easy task. Baker experimented with so many production methods he feared that his product would die as nothing more than an idea. It was at this point that he crossed paths with an engineer with extensive manufacturing experience that directed him to the high-tech hardware and advanced computer systems needed to not only handle the complex process of producing the lens protector itself, but also provide the flexibility needed to manufacture a wide range of lenses on-demand. KLP has perfected its designs and is in the process of evaluating a shortlist of materials and factories to begin production. To cover the costs of the first production run Baker has launched an Indiegogo campaign with exciting rewards including a lifetime supply of protectors. Pre-order is available now. How Koda Lens Protector WorksThose familiar with high-grade smartphone screen protectors will find many parallels in the design and functionality of Koda Lens Protector. The material is of aerospace grade durability and utilizes a self-healing formula to ensure that it will last as long as you keep your glasses or sunglasses. Koda Lens Protector has been designed with the end-user in mind since day one. We have carefully crafted our product to be simple enough to install in your own home using the provided spray solution and applicator. The adhesive is fully transparent, providing invisible protection for your lenses.So why not just buy a smartphone screen protector and apply it to your lenses yourself? There are two reasons that this will not work (trust us, we tried - this was actually how our initial prototype was born!), the first being the curvature of the lenses, and the second being the thickness of the material.While smartphone screen protectors adhere flawlessly to the flat or simple curves of a wraparound smartphone screen, lenses are much more complex. The lens protectors must actually be manufactured specifically to form to the nuances of each specific lens to prevent bubbles and peeling from occuring.Koda Lens Protector is also composed of a specially formulated material that is thinner than smartphone screen protectors. Thicker materials extend too far from the surface of the lens, causing them to peel up from the edges over time and collect dirt and debris under the edges (therefore defeating the purpose of the lens protector).We are always happy to answer questions about our product, just drop us a comment in the campaign and we will get back to you right away!The BudgetWe are raising $57,000 so we can start the first round of production. The patent and engineering fees have already been paid out of pocket, so the funds will go straight to the materials, equipment, and programming needed to put this into action. The costs of production are heavily front-loaded, as the equipment is advanced and a significant amount of custom programming is required to prepare our lens library for production.Once production begins, the ongoing costs are reduced dramatically. From that point forward the bulk of our cost will be the funding of a seamless customer service experience and the expansion of our physical network as we strive to provide local, in-person support to the greatest number of our customers as we can possibly reach.Stretch GoalsWhile we can get Koda Lens Protector off the ground if we hit our funding goals, it will take a lot more to fulfill our mission to #savealltheglasses. The more funds we are able to raise, the more lenses we will be able to keep in our library and support through an expanded physical support network.$83,000 - Free Koda Dog Microfiber Cloth for every campaign contributor$175,000 - Lifetime warranty included free with every Koda Lens Protector$335,000 - Second Koda Lens Protector free for all campaign contributorsPerksA 2 year unlimited warranty is included with any purchase of KLP (unless we are able to hit our $175,000 stretch goal, which will automatically upgrade all KLP purchasers to a lifetime warranty).

story:
Through more than 5 years and 37 iterations, we've meticulously designed Maku sandals wherever life takes us—from city streets to light trails, and every place in between. We wanted a sandal that we could wear every day, walk in, travel with, and still have it come out the other side looking like new. 

Our passion led us on a quest to track down some of the best materials and manufacturers in the world. We accepted nothing less than unmatched comfort, exceptional durability, and real versatility. Out of this (somewhat obsessive) journey was born the Maku sandals you see today. 

And now, we need your help—to make something that was once only available to a few select individuals, available to the entire world. We appreciate your support and everything you can do to help spread the word and get people as excited and passionate about Maku as we are. 

Thanks,
The Maku team - David, Hanane, and William
 


 

Designed and built to last for years, from some of the highest quality materials on the market.

Rubber sole

We tested 50+ types of rubber to find the one that was the most abrasion resistant, flexible, light, puncture resistant, and that had a versatile grip, with just the right shock absorbance. 

Footbed

  • White on Tan: 100% genuine premium leather footbed
  • Red on Black: The footbed will either be made from an advanced 100% genuine premium leather with high color-fastness (i.e. color won’t fade or bleed), or an equally advanced material that has the same qualities as leather
  • Black on Black: Has an anti-slip rubber footbed and is ideal for wet environments

Maku straps

Custom produced especially for Maku, the straps (laces) are made from a special nautical (boating) fiber that resists saltwater, sun, abrasion, lasts for years, and yet is still very soft on the hands of sailors. It looks and feels softer than cotton.
 

 

If you're familiar with the concept of planned obsolescence, then maybe you're as irritated by the practice as we are. Planned Obsolescence is the practice of intentionally and artificially limiting the useful life of a product at the design phase for the purpose of driving more sales.

Maku lives on the opposite end of the spectrum. We're great believers in the “Reduce, Reuse, Recycle” motto, live by it every day, and have designed Makus that way. They're made with some of the best materials in the world, intentionally designed to last for years.
 

 

 

We’ve spent 5 years sourcing and testing some of the best materials on the planet. That's why your Makus come with our Maku Triple Guarantee:

* Certain restrictions may apply. We'll share those with you once we formalize the relationship with our fulfillment partner.
 

We ship worldwide and offer FREE shipping within the US.

For our crowdfunding campaign, sizes are available in US Women’s 4 to US Men’s 13 inclusive (EU 35-46), in whole sizes only. In the near future, we will be adding more sizes, half sizes, and possibly kids' sizes.

After the campaign ends, we will send you a survey asking for your shoe size and choice of Maku sandal. We will also include an accurate method of determining shoe size to get the perfect fit: a template you can use on your foot to find your ideal Maku sandal size.
 

Back in 2009, I thought that going barefoot would solve my knee pain. It didn’t, but something unexpected happened. Back then, I had made myself sandals to run in but ended up wearing them more than all my other shoes. 

I wore them almost every day until they broke. That’s when I decided to buy something similar. This was very frustrating because what I found either felt like cardboard or was bulky or unrefined. So I made my 2nd pair, improving the design and durability. This same story repeats 37 times! 

At some point, I had made a pair of sandals for my partner Hanane, and we'd wear them almost everywhere. People were regularly coming up to us on the street asking us where we got them from. It was obvious that there was something special about these sandals. 

We began accepting orders and had people buying them across 4 continents. That started a long process of “get real-world feedback, improve, repeat.” With every upgrade, we wanted the best materials so the sandals would be even more comfortable and durable. 

5 years and 37 tries later, we finally had it right. So right, in fact, that as soon as we sold 50 pairs, a hundred more lined up. With each pair taking us 4 hours to make by hand, we knew we had to find a better way to bring Makus to the world. 

And that’s why we're here today, reaching out to you. Launching a crowdfunding campaign will help us deliver the unmatched quality, comfort, and design of Maku sandals to you and to the world. 

We love our Makus, and we hope that you want your own Makus as well. Thank you so much for sharing this journey with us!

William Choukeir. From as far back as he can remember, William has been taking things apart and making things (like his own toys, remote-controlled helicopters, meditation chairs, and clothing). When William is disappointed with products available in the market, it’s quite possible that he’ll try to build his own version. He has high standards and is obsessed with making beautiful industrial-quality consumer objects. By day, William is a designer who helps businesses make things people want. It's this combination that initially brought the 1st pair of Makus to life, and drove their persistent improvement, year after year.

David El Achkar. Over the years, David has launched and has helped others launch a variety of businesses. He truly enjoys making things work simply, setting up and optimizing operations, as well as the creativity involved in designing solutions where none were previously available. Early adopter turned co-founder, he joined the Maku team to launch a new brand and setup the infrastructure needed for people all around the world to enjoy what was once limited to a very narrow circle. At his core, David values minimalism, quality, and design. His Makus are the first thing he grabs when leaving home.

Hanane Kai. Hanane is an illustrator, maker of picture books, and an occasional award-winner. She's in love with materials and textures; with their tactile and visual qualities. That passion drove her to source the world for materials she can fall in love with, materials that ended up in Maku sandals. Hanane's special ability to know what stirs emotions in people guides the design direction of Maku. Without her, Makus would have never ventured out of our home into the wild. She has spearheaded efforts of getting early versions onto people's feet, collecting feedback, and integrating it into the final product you see here.

 

For press inquiries, please reach out at press@makulife.com. 

The Maku team is deeply grateful to the following people. They have been instrumental in helping us make it this far. 

Thank you. Very much. 

Adrea Choukeir, Aisha Habli, Anthony Basil, Ashley Choukeir, Bassam Jalgha, Cara Vogl, Chelsea Choukeir, Cherine Khoury, Cynthia Choukeir, David Habchy, Edouard Sioufi, Fadi BouDebs, Fady Kiwan, Farid Saleme, Hassane Slaibi, Hussein El Kotob, Joanna Choukeir, Joanna Kahi, Karim Ghorayeb, Lara Zeidan, Mackram Raydan, Marie Murray, Mark Ashkar, Nadim Kiwan, Nadim Sioufi, Nathaly Gattas, Rachel Ratliff, Renée Abi Saad, Romy Assouad, Roy Hankash, Roy Jamhouri, Samar Kai, Sara Sibai, Sarah Habli, Sarah Hindi, Tara Achkar, Teddy Habchy, Yara Moukalled. 

And, specifically, Road2Film.com without whom we couldn’t have done the video.

Early adopter turned co-founder, he joined the Maku team to launch a new brand and setup the infrastructure needed for people all around the world to enjoy what was once limited to a very narrow circle. At his core, David values minimalism, quality, and design. His Makus are the first thing he grabs when leaving home.
Hanane Kai. Hanane is an illustrator, maker of picture books, and an occasional award-winner. She's in love with materials and textures; with their tactile and visual qualities. That passion drove her to source the world for materials she can fall in love with, materials that ended up in Maku sandals. Hanane's special ability to know what stirs emotions in people guides the design direction of Maku. Without her, Makus would have never ventured out of our home into the wild. She has spearheaded efforts of getting early versions onto people's feet, collecting feedback, and integrating it into the final product you see here.

 

For press inquiries, please reach out at press@makulife.com. 

 
 

The Maku team is deeply grateful to the following people. They have been instrumental in helping us make it this far. 
Thank you. Very much. 
Adrea Choukeir, Aisha Habli, Anthony Basil, Ashley Choukeir, Bassam Jalgha, Cara Vogl, Chelsea Choukeir, Cherine Khoury, Cynthia Choukeir, David Habchy, Edouard Sioufi, Fadi BouDebs, Fady Kiwan, Farid Saleme, Hassane Slaibi, Hussein El Kotob, Joanna Choukeir, Joanna Kahi, Karim Ghorayeb, Lara Zeidan, Mackram Raydan, Marie Murray, Mark Ashkar, Nadim Kiwan, Nadim Sioufi, Nathaly Gattas, Rachel Ratliff, Renée Abi Saad, Romy Assouad, Roy Hankash, Roy Jamhouri, Samar Kai, Sara Sibai, Sarah Habli, Sarah Hindi, Tara Achkar, Teddy Habchy, Yara Moukalled. 
And, specifically, Road2Film.com without whom we couldn’t have done the video.

To view our full FAQ, go to our Kickstarter Campaign Page and scroll all the way down to the bottom.

story:
[ A B O U T  U S ]

WHOWAGWEAR™ is a new, unique online destination that celebrates dogs and those who love them. We embrace self-expression and positive change with the sale of apparel designed for dog’s best friend. Our products combine quality materials and stylish, original dog artwork to support socially responsible and charitable initiatives we like to call #CONSCIOUSCOMMERCE (highest rating by W.R.A.P. for ethical, humane, and lawful working conditions in manufacturing facilities) and #APPARELWITHPURPOSE (20% of all sales donated directly to the ASPCA).

We are dedicated dog owners, creative do-ers, & seasoned professionals in the retail industry who want to channel these forces towards a greater good. Having worked closely together since 2009 for a global lifestyle brand, we developed a strong professional & personal bond while supporting and celebrating each other's work-life & personal-life milestones. A common thread that forever changed both our lives happened in 2012 and 2014 when we became dog owners.

The continuous joy that Ninja (Kris’s Morkie) & Ghost (Em’s Australian Shepherd) bring to our every day has opened our hearts in unimaginable ways. We've connected to other incredible life-changing stories, much like our own, and become more aware of the need for help that exists within the k9 community. The idea of making a difference resonated so deeply we felt a responsibility to inspire impact on a much larger scale than just the two of us. With that in mind, and a single day discussing personalized artwork of their pups on apparel, the WHOWAGWEAR™ platform was born.


[ O U R   M I S S I O N ]

WE WANT TO MAKE SPIRITS SMILE SPREAD LOVE + AWARENESS & MOST IMPORTANTLY TRANSFORM LIVES IN A POSITIVE WAY.

Our intention is to showcase these amazing creatures as a vehicle to transcend “cause art” into real tangible change. And we happily invite you  to join our mission. Through this journey WHOWAGWEAR™ promises to maintain transparency at every touch point — from our suppliers, to our artists, to our partners. We respect genuine connection to our community & strive to make smart, conscious decisions with the  services we provide. As a brand, we want you to be engaged in what you’re buying, be able to share your stories, and connect to all dog lovers alike.

 “Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.” - Helen Keller


[ W H A T ' S  N E X T ]

When we first started WHOWAGWEAR™  there were two goals that we wanted to accomplish — 1) Offering Customize Service and 2) Supporting Local Charities and reporting back to the community as to where your money is going and how it is helping. Up to this point WHOWAGWEAR™ has been self-funded and self-created by the two of us. In order for us to facilitate these two important goals we need a little help — we need a team to build the best platform and products as possible.

Your support is the reason we are able to continue on with our mission. And we have carefully thought of limited-edition perks as a THANK YOU for your donation. These perks are only available through this campaign and cannot be purchased at a later date in our online store.

With your donations we will be able to:

• Build the best digital shopping experience for an easy, yet personal way of ordering, reviewing, and receiving custom service

• Curate and expand our talented team of artists to attend to your custom requests

• Reach out to local charities to create programs and partnerships we believe in

• Facilitate ongoing reports, updates, and information to the community as to how much money has been raised, what it's used for, and how it's helping make a positive difference



[ C R E A T I N G  I M P A C T ]

The money we receive from this campaign will be invested BACK INTO our economy. Knowing that you believe in us enough to invest in our vision gives us the strength and courage to build the best platform possible for this greater good (that all dog lovers) are passionate about.

• Create job opportunities as we expand our team and give employees an opportunity to work towards a cause they believe in 

• Provide more business to our family-owned, MADE IN THE USA printer(s)

• Explore new packaging options that are eco-friendly and sustainable

• Opportunity to expand product lines

• And last but not least, provide a vehicle to support charities



[ C H A L L E N G E S  &  A C C O M P L I S H M E N T S ]

As we mentioned in our video, up to this point, the WHOWAGWEAR™ brand you see today has been concepted, built, and executed by the two Co-Founders.  Collectively, our educational backgrounds are rooted in Business Marketing and Fine Arts, which led to careers specializing in Marketing and Advertising for Apparel and Beauty brands. Over the past 10+ years in the industry, our work has been published in 87+ countries — through various multimedia platforms — including publications such as WWD, InStyle, Vanity Fair, marie clare, GQ, Esquire, Time Magazine, PDN, Travel+Leisure, Refinery29, and Lonny.com. Past and present clients include L’Oréal, Kérastase Paris, Shu Uemura, Estee Lauder, Nautica, Brooks Brothers, Antoine Verglas Studio, PepsiCo, and P&G.

WHOWAGWEAR™ is by far our greatest professional challenge that we've taken on with passionate and happy hearts! With our vision, and your support, we proudly take on this responsibility to YOU and the K9 community to give this brand everything we've got! And because this is a community, we want to evolve it into something WE ALL can be proud of.



[ O T H E R  W A Y S  T O  H E L P ]

We totally understand if you are not able to make a monetary donation!!!

If you know anyone who loves dogs, has been affected by a dog in their life, or simply want to join us in spreading love + awareness, we encourage you to share our campaign. That singular minute you take to share our story with your friends and family has the immense power to spark a domino effect, helping us reach more and more people than we could by ourselves! Every little bit counts. "Little by little, a little becomes A LOT."



[ P E R K  P I C S ]

A special thanks to fellow dog-lover and talented videographer Calvin Swaim!!!

story:
Hi, I’m Denise Pieracci.  I’m a costume designer from the San Francisco Bay Area, experienced in custom made historical clothing and tailored menswear.

Recently, I've been inspired to produce a new line of affordable contemporary clothing for, and inspired by, the Modern Urban Woman, made in the San Francisco Bay Area by local artisans.  We are looking for Angels to help us fund  Domina Designs Debut Collection.

Most ready to wear clothing is geared towards women 20 - 35 years old. The biggest error they make is that these clothes do not fit real women correctly. By doing that, they are ignoring the largest, and fastest growing market, that of today's "Younger" 35 - 55 year old woman.

I’ve been experimenting with casual day wear, trying to find what works best for me and my busy  life.  What I need, is clothing that is comfortable, fits me well, and is easy to take care of.  What I want is clothing that makes me feel attractive and ready to tackle the world, without being over complicated.  And FUN!   Fun clothing is de rigueur!

                     - - A sample of the type of knit tops we want to produce - -

                                                   - - Not a Final Design - -

So, I was inspired to create a new line of modern, everyday clothing for myself, for REAL women.

Women like my friends.  Women like myself.  We work.  We travel.   We're super busy. The Modern Woman doesn't have time to waste stressing over clothes.

And that’s what I’ve come up with, the perfect go-to clothing for your busy day.  Classic styling in modern fabrics.  Easy wear.  Easy care.  Best of all, easy elegance.  All at an affordable price.


     - - Sample of twin needle finishes and brass rivet embellishments - -

And, on top of that, it’s all kissed with the magic of our original artwork.   The key to setting our designs apart from the rest in the market, is that the new Embroidery Machine will enable us to create unique and original textiles, that no one else has.

Achieving our fundraising goals will enable us to create a real production studio, to produce the clothing line locally - instead of using overseas contractors, which is a plus for our local economy - and to be able to competitively market it.

The budget covers all Production Costs, hiring Marketing and P/R professionals, a budget for hiring local labor for production, and most importantly, new equipment, including a commercial grade, 4 color computerized embroidery machine. 

 

 - a sample of the type of artwork that will be used for embroidery patterns -


We have a multi-level plan for marketing.  We'll launch retail sales on Etsy, thru my current shop, Satin Shadow Designs, which already has a high profile and increased visibility and traffic.  Once sales of Domina Designs can support it, we'll create it's own shop on Etsy.

We will also offer Domina Designs for the wholesale market.  Currently, there are 2 boutiques interested our work, and eager to see the new designs.    I’ve made contacts with a few fashion reps who are also interested in seeing the new collection samples when they are ready. We welcome finding more Reps or PR people that can help with both the initial launch and ongoing marketing needs.

Upon advisement, the final designs will not be made public until the samples are made.  We will document our progress on production, and keep you updated through photos and videos.  To get an idea of fabrics, and patterns and colors, take a sneak peak here, at our "sample" website.

  https://sites.google.com/site/dominadesigns/


Your support means the world to us.  One of the many ways you can show your support is to share this page, and our mission, with your friends.  Post it to Facebook and share it on Twitter.  If you like and believe in what we are doing, chances are other Angels will too. 


What Your Contributions Will Provide

$  5,000 for fabrics and trims to develop and produce the line

$  5,000 for competitive labor wages:

  • pattern making

  • sample sewing

  • attaching embellishments

  • executing custom embroidery

$  5,000 for contracting professional Marketing, PR and photography services

$  5,000 for Misc equipment  and sewing supplies:

  • Heavy duty sewing machines, work tables   

  • Shelving, rolling racks

  • Misc supplies like pattern paper, pins, scissors, etc

$ 10,000 for state of the art computerized Embroidery machine

This is pivotal to making our line unique, and setting it apart from all the others

If we don't reach our fundraising goals, we will have to scale back on the number of garments we produce, and possibly not get all the equipment we need.

  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    •  get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
    • Remember:  use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who we are

Chair.i.tee is a women's loungewear brand based in sunny San Diego, California. Using only the highest quality, buttery soft fabrics, we're the proud creators of The Ultimate Feel Good Tee. With every tee-shirt purchased we donate to women's charities around the world in support of women's rights, health, economic success and overall well being*. Whether it’s a new mom in Africa who needs a fistula surgery, a widow in India seeking refuge, or a sex trafficking victim in Nepal who needs vocational training, your purchase supports a woman in need. Wear one of our tees and feel good both inside and out! All items are 100% USA made.
 
* We will donate 50% of our direct sale proceeds (online sales) and 25% of our wholesale proceeds (boutique sales) to our charities. See detailed info below.
 

Why tee-shirts?

I started Chair.i.tee for two reasons:

1.) Because I love wearing soft things. And this tee-shirt is so silky soft you’ll want to hug yourself when you wear it. Promise. It also has what I like to call "eating room." Meaning you can eat your burrito at lunch, feel uncomfortably bloated, and then still look totally cute and thin when you stand up and walk out the Chipotle door. No belly outlines show with this tee-shirt. That's another promise!

2.) I want to help women in need. Be it lack of food, shelter or education, sex trafficking, forced prostitution, or any other kind of physical or emotional abuse, the fact is there are millions of women around the world who desperately need help. Another fact is that women are consumers - especially in the West. We know what we want, and we usually get it. So if we’re going to spend money on things we buy anyway, why shouldn’t it support a good cause?
 

What We Need & What You Get

So far I've personally invested about $3,000 to cover pre-production costs (business integration/legal fees, pattern making/adjustment costs, sample production costs, etc.). Currently I need about $2,000 in funds to help cover the first round of production (fabric and manufacturing costs, care labels and hang tags, etc.).
 
Which, thanks to Indiegogo, is where you come in!
 
For $35 you’ll get a SOLID WHITE V-NECK Chair.i.tee (see, it’s not just a brand, it’s a noun!). You'll also get a Chair.i.tee sticker and a HUGE thank you on our website.
 
All tees are made of 95% Siro Micro Modal and 5% Spandex. Siro is a very high end specialty yarn that comes all the way from trees in the Austrian Alps*. This accounts for why our tees are so buttery soft!
 
Each tee will come with a small, soft white satin tag with the Chair.i.tee logo on the front bottom hem (see photo). This tag is called a "clamp tag" which means it will fold underneath the tee-shirt. I intentionally selected this tag so that I could insert a special thank you message underneath, so each time you do laundry or take it off you'll be reminded that Chair.i.tee appreciates your support! :)  
 
The care label will be imprinted on the inside back via heat transfer (see photo). No itchy/scratchy tags here!
 
What's also neat about our tees is that each one comes with a hang tag (see photo) made of special seed paper. So rather than just cut off and throw away the tag like you would with any other item of clothing, you can pot or plant the tag in the ground and it will grow flowers. (Seriously, it will). Such a fun novelty!
 
Sizes come in XS, S, M and L. Our tees run slightly large, so if you prefer a slimmer fit, please order one size down.
 
I'd love to have pictures of the completely finished tees, but unfortunately given the logistics of the manufacturing process I'd have to order and pay for all materials (fabric, tags, etc.) before they'll assemlble a 100% finished product, and I just don't have enough to do that yet.
 
 *Yarn is imported, but fabric is milled in Los Angeles.
 
Additional perks:
 
For $60 you'll get 2 SOLID WHITE V-NECK Chair.i.tees ($5 off each), a Chair.i.tee sticker and a HUGE thank you on our website.
 
For $100 you'll get 4 V-NECK Chair.i.tees ($10 off each) in either WHITE or CHARCOAL GRAY- pick whatever color combination you prefer. You'll also receive two Chair.i.tee stickers and a personalized thank you on our website. 
 
For $200 you'll get 10 V-NECK Chair.i.tees ($15 off each) in either WHITE or CHARCOAL GRAY- pick whatever color combination you prefer.  You'll also receive three Chair.i.tee stickers and a personalized thank you on our website. 
 
These would make great birthday or holiday gifts, so buy away! I promise you're going to LOVE this tee. We're like the luxurious feel of James Perse basics meets Tom's Shoes humanitarianism. There's a reason we're calling it The Ultimate Feel Good Tee. It truly is.
 

The Impact

We plan to donate 50% of our direct sale proceeds and 25% of our wholesale proceeds to 3 specific women's charities:
 
1.) Guild for Service - http://guildforservice.org/
 
Empowering the widows of Vrindavan.
 
As seen on "Oprah's Next Chapter," Dr. V. Mohini Giri founded Ma Dham, a shelter for the thousands of widows in India who are outcast from society due to their stigmatized marital status.
 
"At our shelter home in Vrindavan, Ma Dham, thousands of widows have been rehabilitated. The home offers holistic opportunities for development by providing food, clothing, shelter, vocational training, medical aid and counseling to the destitute widows. The home presently shelters about 120 widows, the majority of them being elderly and suffering from ailments that sometimes require constant medical attention.  The target of rehabilitating the widows of Vrindavan is an enormous one. Our home, Ma Dham, is a small beginning. You can care and share in this effort of giving a life of dignity to the 16,000 widows in Vrindavan." - Guild For Service website
 
Chair.i.tee proceeds will help cover the shelter, food and vocational training costs required to keep Ma Dham up and running.
 
 
2.) The WPPC Nepal Foundation - http://www.wppcnepal.org
 
Fighting against human trafficking and changing lives one woman, one child at a time.
 
"WPPC Nepal Foundation is a nonprofit charity corporation registered in the State of Washington. The main role of the foundation is to protect woman and children who have either been a victim of trafficking or are at risk of being trafficked.  At WPPC Nepal Foundation we fight against trafficking and the sexual exploitation of women and children. We provide support to returned and rescued women and children by providing long term service and other opportunities. WPPC Nepal Foundation supports programs that help victims of trafficking, most notably programs operated by the Women's Prevention and Protection Center in Hetauda, Nepal. The foundation also plays vital role to raise funds and increase awareness about the Human trafficking problem of Nepal in the United States and globally within Nepali and international communities." - The WPPC Nepal Foundation website
 
Chair.i.tee proceeds will help cover the vocational training costs for survivors at the Women's Prevention and Protection Center.
 
 
3.) The Fistula Foundation - http://www.fistulafoundation.org/
 
Help give women a new life.
 
What is a fistula?
 
"Obstetric fistula is the most devastating and serious of all childbirth injuries. It happens because most mothers in poor countries give birth without any medical help. So many are young girls. Complications from pregnancy and childbirth are among the leading causes of death and disability for women of reproductive age in these places. Obstetric fistula was largely eliminated in the United States in the latter part of the 19th century and early 20th century with improved obstetric care in general and the use of c-sections in particular to relieve obstructed labor.

After enduring days of agonizing, obstructed labor a woman's body is literally broken by childbirth. During labor contractions, the baby's head is constantly pushing against the mother’s pelvic bone — causing tissue to die due to lack of blood flow to this area. All of that pushing creates a hole, or in medical terms a "fistula", between the birth passage and an internal organ such as the bladder or rectum. A woman cannot hold her urine, and sometimes bowel content as well.

Her baby is unlikely to survive. If she survives, a woman with fistula is likely to be rejected by her husband because of her inability to bear more children and her foul smell. She will be shunned by her community and forced to live an isolated existence. These women suffer profound psychological trauma resulting from their utter loss of status and dignity, in addition to suffering constantly from their physical internal injury." - Fistula Foundation website

Through the "Love-a-sister" sponsorship program, Chair.i.tee proceeds will go to pay for fistula surgeries.

 

Share our story

Don't have any money to give? No worries! You can help us spread the word of our campaign through Indiegogo and social media channels!
 
Tweet us @TheFeelGoodTee https://twitter.com/TheFeelGoodTee
Like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/chairitee
story_txt:
Who we are
Chair.i.tee is a women's loungewear brand based in sunny San Diego, California. Using only the highest quality, buttery soft fabrics, we're the proud creators of The Ultimate Feel Good Tee. With every tee-shirt purchased we donate to women's charities around the world in support of women's rights, health, economic success and overall well being*. Whether it’s a new mom in Africa who needs a fistula surgery, a widow in India seeking refuge, or a sex trafficking victim in Nepal who needs vocational training, your purchase supports a woman in need. Wear one of our tees and feel good both inside and out! All items are 100% USA made.

 
* We will donate 50% of our direct sale proceeds (online sales) and 25% of our wholesale proceeds (boutique sales) to our charities. See detailed info below.
 

Why tee-shirts?
I started Chair.i.tee for two reasons:

1.) Because I love wearing soft things. And this tee-shirt is so silky soft you’ll want to hug yourself when you wear it. Promise. It also has what I like to call "eating room." Meaning you can eat your burrito at lunch, feel uncomfortably bloated, and then still look totally cute and thin when you stand up and walk out the Chipotle door. No belly outlines show with this tee-shirt. That's another promise!

2.) I want to help women in need. Be it lack of food, shelter or education, sex trafficking, forced prostitution, or any other kind of physical or emotional abuse, the fact is there are millions of women around the world who desperately need help. Another fact is that women are consumers - especially in the West. We know what we want, and we usually get it. So if we’re going to spend money on things we buy anyway, why shouldn’t it support a good cause?
 

What We Need & What You Get
So far I've personally invested about $3,000 to cover pre-production costs (business integration/legal fees, pattern making/adjustment costs, sample production costs, etc.). Currently I need about $2,000 in funds to help cover the first round of production (fabric and manufacturing costs, care labels and hang tags, etc.).
 
Which, thanks to Indiegogo, is where you come in!
 

For $35 you’ll get a SOLID WHITE V-NECK Chair.i.tee (see, it’s not just a brand, it’s a noun!). You'll also get a Chair.i.tee sticker and a HUGE thank you on our website.

 
All tees are made of 95% Siro Micro Modal and 5% Spandex. Siro is a very high end specialty yarn that comes all the way from trees in the Austrian Alps*. This accounts for why our tees are so buttery soft!
 
Each tee will come with a small, soft white satin tag with the Chair.i.tee logo on the front bottom hem (see photo). This tag is called a "clamp tag" which means it will fold underneath the tee-shirt. I intentionally selected this tag so that I could insert a special thank you message underneath, so each time you do laundry or take it off you'll be reminded that Chair.i.tee appreciates your support! :)  
 
The care label will be imprinted on the inside back via heat transfer (see photo). No itchy/scratchy tags here!
 
What's also neat about our tees is that each one comes with a hang tag (see photo) made of special seed paper. So rather than just cut off and throw away the tag like you would with any other item of clothing, you can pot or plant the tag in the ground and it will grow flowers. (Seriously, it will). Such a fun novelty!
 

Sizes come in XS, S, M and L. Our tees run slightly large, so if you prefer a slimmer fit, please order one size down.
 
I'd love to have pictures of the completely finished tees, but unfortunately given the logistics of the manufacturing process I'd have to order and pay for all materials (fabric, tags, etc.) before they'll assemlble a 100% finished product, and I just don't have enough to do that yet.
 
 *Yarn is imported, but fabric is milled in Los Angeles.
 
Additional perks:
 
For $60 you'll get 2 SOLID WHITE V-NECK Chair.i.tees ($5 off each), a Chair.i.tee sticker and a HUGE thank you on our website.
 
For $100 you'll get 4 V-NECK  Chair.i.tees ($10 off each) in either WHITE or CHARCOAL GRAY- pick whatever color combination you prefer. You'll also receive two Chair.i.tee stickers and a personalized thank you on our website.  
 
For $200 you'll get 10 V-NECK Chair.i.tees ($15 off each) in either WHITE or CHARCOAL GRAY- pick whatever color combination you prefer.  You'll also receive three Chair.i.tee stickers and a personalized thank you on our website.  
 
These would make great birthday or holiday gifts, so buy away! I promise you're going to LOVE this tee. We're like the luxurious feel of James Perse basics meets Tom's Shoes humanitarianism. There's a reason we're calling it The Ultimate Feel Good Tee. It truly is.
 

The Impact
We plan to donate 50% of our direct sale proceeds and 25% of our wholesale proceeds to 3 specific women's charities:
 

1.) Guild for Service - http://guildforservice.org/

 
Empowering the widows of Vrindavan.
 
As seen on "Oprah's Next Chapter," Dr. V. Mohini Giri founded Ma Dham, a shelter for the thousands of widows in India who are outcast from society due to their stigmatized marital status.
 
"At our shelter home in Vrindavan, Ma Dham, thousands of widows have been rehabilitated. The home offers holistic opportunities for development by providing food, clothing, shelter, vocational training, medical aid and counseling to the destitute widows. The home presently shelters about 120 widows, the majority of them being elderly and suffering from ailments that sometimes require constant medical attention.  The target of rehabilitating the widows of Vrindavan is an enormous one. Our home, Ma Dham, is a small beginning. You can care and share in this effort of giving a life of dignity to the 16,000 widows in Vrindavan." - Guild For Service website

 
Chair.i.tee proceeds will help cover the shelter, food and vocational training costs required to keep Ma Dham up and running.
 
 

2.) The WPPC Nepal Foundation - http://www.wppcnepal.org

 
Fighting against human trafficking and changing lives one woman, one child at a time.
 
"WPPC Nepal Foundation is a nonprofit charity corporation registered in the State of Washington. The main role of the foundation is to protect woman and children who have either been a victim of trafficking or are at risk of being trafficked.  At WPPC Nepal Foundation we fight against trafficking and the sexual exploitation of women and children. We provide support to returned and rescued women and children by providing long term service and other opportunities. WPPC Nepal Foundation supports programs that help victims of trafficking, most notably programs operated by the Women's Prevention and Protection Center in Hetauda, Nepal. The foundation also plays vital role to raise funds and increase awareness about the Human trafficking problem of Nepal in the United States and globally within Nepali and international communities." - The WPPC Nepal Foundation website

 
Chair.i.tee proceeds will help cover the vocational training costs for survivors at the Women's Prevention and Protection Center.
 
 

3.) The Fistula Foundation - http://www.fistulafoundation.org/

 
Help give women a new life.
 
What is a fistula?
 
"Obstetric fistula is the most devastating and serious of all childbirth injuries. It happens because most mothers in poor countries give birth without any medical help. So many are young girls. Complications from pregnancy and childbirth are among the leading causes of death and disability for women of reproductive age in these places. Obstetric fistula was largely eliminated in the United States in the latter part of the 19th century and early 20th century with improved obstetric care in general and the use of c-sections in particular to relieve obstructed labor.
After enduring days of agonizing, obstructed labor a woman's body is literally broken by childbirth. During labor contractions, the baby's head is constantly pushing against the mother’s pelvic bone — causing tissue to die due to lack of blood flow to this area. All of that pushing creates a hole, or in medical terms a "fistula", between the birth passage and an internal organ such as the bladder or rectum. A woman cannot hold her urine, and sometimes bowel content as well.
Her baby is unlikely to survive. If she survives, a woman with fistula is likely to be rejected by her husband because of her inability to bear more children and her foul smell. She will be shunned by her community and forced to live an isolated existence. These women suffer profound psychological trauma resulting from their utter loss of status and dignity, in addition to suffering constantly from their physical internal injury." - Fistula Foundation website
Through the "Love-a-sister" sponsorship program, Chair.i.tee proceeds will go to pay for fistula surgeries.
 


Share our story
Don't have any money to give? No worries! You can help us spread the word of our campaign through Indiegogo and social media channels!
 
Tweet us @TheFeelGoodTee https://twitter.com/TheFeelGoodTee

Like us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/chairitee

story:
Plus many many more each day - Frogglez is taking the swim goggles market by storm!

 

WHY FROGGLEZ?

 

I am a parent of 3 little kids that now are 9, 7 and 5 years old. I struggled with swim goggles for years trying to find a pair that was comfortable, did not pull hair out or involved a battle to get on. Finally I began making prototypes of what now has evolved into the patent pending Frogglez Goggles. My kids have worn these prototypes for over a year now and parents kept asking me where they could get a pair...

Now, the first few prototypes were nothing to write home about - put together with love, sweat and sometimes tears (the kids have been great most of the time :) ), but the final product turned out great! I decided to call the company "Made By My Dad" per my kids suggestion.

Frogglez Goggles are swim goggles made out of neoprene (wetsuit material) with a patent pending strap design. This design fits 90% of children between the ages of 3 and 9 very comfortably. There is no need to adjust the swim goggles as they conform to the back of the head and create a snug but not overly tight fit.

Furthermore, we selected the best fitting goggles we could find after 2 years of trying different types. Then we tinted them to match the color of the Frogglez strap to block some light for the pink and the blue, and made them a cool gray for the green Frogglez.

We do make Frogglez Goggles in REGULAR and LARGE size, giving you some options for finding the best fit:

REGULAR: Kids 5/6 and under (head circumference of 19 inches or less)

LARGE: Kids 6+ (head size 19 inches or more)

If in doubt about which sized would work best for your little ones, wrap a string around their head and measure it!

Frogglez Goggles come in 3 different colors, PINK, GREEN and BLUE. 

Frogglez are designed for non-competitive swimmers that simply want a more comfortable, fun and stylish option compared to the archaic, traditional swim goggles.

 

 *exact colors will vary slightly

SECOND PLACE ON DAILY GROMMET PITCH - Product Launch Competition!

We were VERY excited when the Daily Grommet (www.DailyGrommet.com) selected Frogglez as a TOP 10 PRODUCT out of over 145 entries which competed at the Daily Grommet LIVE product pitch #grommetpitch in Fenway Park, Boston. You can view our entry here:  http://www.dailygrommet.com/blog/frogglez/ - and we were THRILLED when we got SECOND PLACE (should have been first, but who is counting) :)

 

 

We Are Ready:

 

The successful protoypes have been tested for a complete swim season

The artwork and logo are done 

The packaging is done 

The hangtag for retail display is done 

The website is done - www.FrogglezGoggles.com

 

 

The patent is pending (since 7/2011)

The trademark is done and accepted

We have established relationships with social media giants that are all very exicted about Frogglez Goggles. 

All that is left is to create the final product in a quantity we can launch with - 3000 units or more. 

 

There is no guesswork, we are ready to go!

 

How will we spend the funds?

  • Finalize the prototypes to make sure they are perfect
  • Place an order of 3000 Frogglez Goggles or more
  • Launch a social media campaign

If we collect more than our required minimum then we will consider adding further designs.

To ensure a successful launch of Frogglez Goggles, I kindly ask all of you help spread the word about Frogglez Goggles on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest or any other social medium you have access to. 

 

Thank you thank you thank you!

Don't have children? Be different, buy a pair as a gift! It's unique and thoughtful, exactly what everyone is looking for in a gift.

 

THE DETAILS

Frogglez Goggles

  • made out of neoprene covered in a smooth, comfortable material that glides over hair, not pulling on it like traditional swim goggles do
  • one size fits most without tedious adjustments (2 sizes available just in case)
  • strap stays above ears vs traditional straps that pull ears down
  • printable strap design allows for unlimited style options
  • Frogglez float, other goggles sink to bottom of pool
  • kids can put them on by themselves without trouble
  • Kid size, leak preventing goggle design tinted to match strap
  • Patent Pending Design
  • Protected by Trademark

Frogglez Goggles are a complete redesign of traditional swim goggles. Testing over the last year by real kids has proven that Frogglez Goggles are a hit. Parents consistently asked me where they could get a pair (their kids bugged them to get some as well).

By choosing to invest in Frogglez Goggles you become part of something big, something fun, something different - a shift in the swim goggle market from a utilitarian to a fashion and comfort oriented design. Frogglez Goggles will continue to evolve and grow with more designs, shapes and options being offered over time.

Everyone who invests in Frogglez Goggles will receive continuous updates on new products and developments, plus, first right to order new designs and products before anyone else, at a discount.

 

THANK YOU

Thank you for taking a look at my project. Please take a look at my offers and consider backing me so that Frogglez Goggles can be available for the 2013 swim season.

story:
Calees Plus Size Shoes For Women. 

Defining femininity by a new standard which says, My Big is Beautiful!

THE VISION 

Hello Everyone,

My Name is Lisa Carmichael founder of Calee's Shoes.

It's often said, "Necessity is the Mother of invention." You see I wear a perfect size 12 shoe.  I would find myself running from where the sun rises to where it sets to find a shoe and still arrive home empty handed. This was very frustrating to me - the difficulty of trying to find fashionable and affordable shoes in my size.  During a telephone conversation with a good friend, I shared my frustration and she in turn saw my vision and commented,  "If you opened your own store, your search would be over."

The Mission

My mission is inspire the many women and girls alike who have been made to feel cursed, flawed, or self-conscious simply because of the size of her feet.  To empower them to embrace their own uniqueness and define femininity by a new standard which says, My Big Is Beautiful!

CaleesShoes.com will... 

 

  • Begin where department stores end by catering solely to women who wear sizes 9 through 13.  Finally a store that's exclusively yours.
  • Redefine the shoe shopping experience for we women who leave a larger footprint.
  • Offer great value on  fabulous brand name shoes for the one low price of just $49.95, every shoe, every time!
  • Provide a vast variety of styles that will create more opportunities for women who appreciate value and wear larger sizes to look and feel absolutely gorgeous!

 

Completion of Indiegogo! 

Pending a successful launch, I am anticipating placing the initial orders. If we are able to meet our funding goal, your contributions will enable me to establish new accounts with suppliers. 

100% of the funds raised will be allocated towards purchasing inventory and marketing the launch of the site.


 


Why Should You Support?

  • Because the majority of shoe stores today are overwhelmingly focused on women who wear sizes 6 through 10. While this focus is relevant for the needs of most buyers, it tends to overlook and downplay the important needs of buyers whose sizes extend beyond the so-called norm. So, what about us? 
  • Because you want to support an entrepreneur who has taken the time to recognize your existence and the need for EVERY WOMAN to have selection without limitation.
  • Because you'll receive some pretty awesome incentives for your support!


Fabulous Shoes!

           

                       Sincere Gratitude - Thanks!                                           

                                                                    Awesome Refrigerator Magnet                                                                                   

Super Stylish Tote 


United We Can Make A Difference

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you love shoes? Great! Your contribution is critical so please, join me, contact me, and share me with your friends and family.

Help me, help you. You deserve it!  

 

**Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well**
