story:
The Ningaloo Reef is a custom designed 316L grade stainless steel tool sports/dive watch rated to withstand 300m/1000ft of water pressure. 316L Steel grade is chosen by most luxury watchmakers for it’s superior corrosion resistance beneficial in marine environments. 

A highly legible dial and extremely robust CNC machined case with a combination of bead blasted and brushed finishes gives it a rugged elegance. Every part has been meticulously designed, refined and engineered to the highest level of quality, on par with many Swiss made watches.

Our bezel consists of a custom designed 316L grade stainless steel outer casing and inlaid with ceramic. We chose ceramic for its ability to deliver extreme durability and longevity, while being highly resistant to scratching and fading. Our ceramic inserts have a subtle matte finish and the slightly recessed markers are filled with industry leading BGW-9 Superluminova lume. The custom 120-click unidirectional bezel is easy to grip which adds functionality to the watch.

The crown has been designed to compliment our bezel which features the same grip pattern, combination of bead blasted and brushed finishes and is emblazoned with our logo. The engineered crown has been designed to maximise ease for unscrewing, setting the time and winding.

The watch features a single domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating on the inside. Sapphire crystal is chosen for its brilliant clarity to maximise legibility in any light and for its exceptional scratch resistance. The anti-reflective coating ensures maximum legibility during daylight by reducing glare. We wanted the bezel and crystal interface to be as smooth as possible.

The hands offer a delicate aesthetic, yet maintain a strong presence. Hour and minute hands are lume filled and the shape of the hands compliment the shapes and proportions of the dial ensuring effortless readability; a design priority throughout. The blue second hand is a nod to the Ningaloo Reef's azure waters.

We wanted to create a design that was unique, yet functional as a tool watch. It was paramount that we got the proportions and shapes of the markers just right, ensuring that they are in complete harmony with the shape of the hands.

The addition of a sandwich dial provides a sense of depth and contributes towards the overall engineered appearance of the watch whilst maintaining a sense of sophistication. The dial design is kept clean and legible, with large markers and numbers and subtle branding. Superluminova lume on the dial and hands enable excellent reading in darkness.

The lugs on the Ningaloo Reef are drilled to accept stainless steel screw bars with hex heads. The screw bars provide both a functional and aesthetic purpose, straps are securely fixed and the engineered appearance contributes to the overall feel of a tough, functional and dependable tool.

The caseback is designed to be ultra tough featuring a deep engraved brand logo and is secured to the case with six (6) machine screws which further enhances the overall engineered aesthetic of the watch.

We made a conscious decision to power the Ningaloo Reef with the Japanese made Miyota 9015 movement. Its a great performer and more than rivals its Swiss counterparts for accuracy and reliability. The 9015 features a decent power reserve, it’s an automatic movement that can be manually wound and incorporates a hacking seconds hand for synchronising between multiple time keeping devices. 

The 9015 operates at 28,800 vibrations per hour with a power reserve of 42 hours. Given, there are movements out there with larger power reserves and faster sweeps, but these tend to come at a premium and often spend more time on the work bench. We just want the Ningaloo Reef to enjoy more time on the wrist.

The beautifully textured thick waterproof leather watch straps are made from top grain leather which is sturdy yet comfortable on the wrist. The straps taper in thickness from 5mm thick and 24mm wide at the lug end to 3mm thick and 22mm wide at the buckle. Each strap is beautifully finished with white stitching with the Duzu logo debossed on  the inside. 

The stainless steel brushed/beadblasted version comes with white stitching and the matte black DLC version comes with black stitching.

The stainless steel buckle has a brushed finish which matches the case well and the top bar of the buckle is emblazoned with the Duzu logo.

The dial indices and markers, watch hands and bezel markers are filled with industry-leading Superluminova BGW-9 luminescent pigment. Superluminova lume was chosen for its bright and long lasting glow. The subtle blue glow of the BGW-9 is another tribute to the Ningaloo Reef's azure waters.

The Duzu Ningaloo Reef is available in two case variants namely the Brushed/Beadblasted Stainless Steel watch and the Matte DLC (Diamond Like Carbon) coated Stainless Steel watch. 

Each variant is also available with three dial colour options namely Matte Black (standard), Orange and Aqua.

CASE MATERIAL: 316L Stainless steel marine grade available in either matte DLC coated finish or brushed/bead blasted finish

CASE DIAMETER: 44mm (excluding crown) CASE LENGTH: 52mm

CASE HEIGHT: 15.5mm (case), 16.5mm (including crystal) 

LUG WIDTH: 24mm CROWN DIAMETER: 8mm screwed down custom crown with deep etched logo 

CRYSTAL: 4mm Thick single domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating 

BEZEL: Custom 316L stainless steel bezel with lumed ceramic insert (matt finish) 

DIAL: Custom sandwich dial with lumed markers and numbers

CASEBACK: Custom 316L stainless steel caseback with deep etched logo and machine screw fixings 

LUME: BGW-9 Superluminova lume to bezel insert markers, hour/min.hands and dial 

WATER RESISTANCE: 300m / 1000 feet

MOVEMENT: Japan made Miyota 9015

The Duzu Ningaloo Reef was designed in Australia but is being manufactured in China. Throughout the production and quality control phases, we will keep all our backers informed as to the status via email, our Facebook page and Twitter.

Our Kickstarter campaign finished at the beginning of July 2018. We are currently taking pre-orders which will align with our current manufacturing timeframe. The program below is based on our Kickstarter campaign and any orders fulfilled here will be rolled into the current program.

You will receive the watch in a custom leather watch roll placed inside an inner carton box with Duzu logo. The packaging will include: 

• Duzu Ningaloo Reef watch 

• Watch tool for strap changes 

• Warranty card

We would like to extend a special thank you to Shane Snider (Watcha), Stephen Mazinger (Time to Blog Watches), The Time Bum and Oceanictime.

Every Duzu Ningaloo Reef comes with a 1 year warranty against manufacturing material defects. We will, within twelve months from the date of purchase, repair or replace the movement of your watch free of charge if the movement proves to be defective in material or workmanship under normal use. 

The warranty does not cover damage arising from normal wear, scratches, accidents or misuse, or from any alteration, service or repair performed by any party other than Duzu Watches.

The Duzu Ningaloo Reef ships from Australia via courier to anywhere worldwide. You'll need to confirm any import duties you may be required to pay with your local customs office. 

When backing the project, you'll be asked where in the world you'd like your watch shipped. The shipping fee is fixed to all countries in the world. We'll contact you when the project funds to obtain your address.

Risks and challenges

Every project has associated risks. We are not immune to these. Manufacturing any item takes a lot of work, and sometimes things do not always go according to plan, with unexpected hiccups along the way. We have gone to great lengths to mitigate as many risks as possible that are within our control with the aim of delivering the product to you within the prescribed timeframe. For this reason we have aligned ourselves with a reputable manufacturer who prides themselves on keeping their customers informed without making unrealistic promises.

We will ensure that we keep our customers up-to-date during the production process. This will be done via regular updates.

Should any delays occur along the way with regards to production, we will be as transparent as possible to ensure that our backers are fully informed.
story_txt:
The Ningaloo Reef is a custom designed 316L grade stainless steel tool sports/dive watch rated to withstand 300m/1000ft of water pressure. 316L Steel grade is chosen by most luxury watchmakers for it’s superior corrosion resistance beneficial in marine environments. 

A highly legible dial and extremely robust CNC machined case with a combination of bead blasted and brushed finishes gives it a rugged elegance. Every part has been meticulously designed, refined and engineered to the highest level of quality, on par with many Swiss made watches.

Our bezel consists of a custom designed 316L grade stainless steel outer casing and inlaid with ceramic. We chose ceramic for its ability to deliver extreme durability and longevity, while being highly resistant to scratching and fading. Our ceramic inserts have a subtle matte finish and the slightly recessed markers are filled with industry leading BGW-9 Superluminova lume. The custom 120-click unidirectional bezel is easy to grip which adds functionality to the watch.

The crown has been designed to compliment our bezel which features the same grip pattern, combination of bead blasted and brushed finishes and is emblazoned with our logo. The engineered crown has been designed to maximise ease for unscrewing, setting the time and winding.

The watch features a single domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating on the inside. Sapphire crystal is chosen for its brilliant clarity to maximise legibility in any light and for its exceptional scratch resistance. The anti-reflective coating ensures maximum legibility during daylight by reducing glare. We wanted the bezel and crystal interface to be as smooth as possible.

The hands offer a delicate aesthetic, yet maintain a strong presence. Hour and minute hands are lume filled and the shape of the hands compliment the shapes and proportions of the dial ensuring effortless readability; a design priority throughout. The blue second hand is a nod to the Ningaloo Reef's azure waters.
We wanted to create a design that was unique, yet functional as a tool watch. It was paramount that we got the proportions and shapes of the markers just right, ensuring that they are in complete harmony with the shape of the hands.
The addition of a sandwich dial provides a sense of depth and contributes towards the overall engineered appearance of the watch whilst maintaining a sense of sophistication. The dial design is kept clean and legible, with large markers and numbers and subtle branding. Superluminova lume on the dial and hands enable excellent reading in darkness.

The lugs on the Ningaloo Reef are drilled to accept stainless steel screw bars with hex heads. The screw bars provide both a functional and aesthetic purpose, straps are securely fixed and the engineered appearance contributes to the overall feel of a tough, functional and dependable tool.

The caseback is designed to be ultra tough featuring a deep engraved brand logo and is secured to the case with six (6) machine screws which further enhances the overall engineered aesthetic of the watch.

We made a conscious decision to power the Ningaloo Reef with the Japanese made Miyota 9015 movement. Its a great performer and more than rivals its Swiss counterparts for accuracy and reliability. The 9015 features a decent power reserve, it’s an automatic movement that can be manually wound and incorporates a hacking seconds hand for synchronising between multiple time keeping devices. 
The 9015 operates at 28,800 vibrations per hour with a power reserve of 42 hours. Given, there are movements out there with larger power reserves and faster sweeps, but these tend to come at a premium and often spend more time on the work bench. We just want the Ningaloo Reef to enjoy more time on the wrist.

The beautifully textured thick waterproof leather watch straps are made from top grain leather which is sturdy yet comfortable on the wrist. The straps taper in thickness from 5mm thick and 24mm wide at the lug end to 3mm thick and 22mm wide at the buckle. Each strap is beautifully finished with white stitching with the Duzu logo debossed on  the inside. 
The stainless steel brushed/beadblasted version comes with white stitching and the matte black DLC version comes with black stitching.
The stainless steel buckle has a brushed finish which matches the case well and the top bar of the buckle is emblazoned with the Duzu logo.

The dial indices and markers, watch hands and bezel markers are filled with industry-leading Superluminova BGW-9 luminescent pigment. Superluminova lume was chosen for its bright and long lasting glow. The subtle blue glow of the BGW-9 is another tribute to the Ningaloo Reef's azure waters.

The Duzu Ningaloo Reef is available in two case variants namely the Brushed/Beadblasted Stainless Steel watch and the Matte DLC (Diamond Like Carbon) coated Stainless Steel watch. 
Each variant is also available with three dial colour options namely Matte Black (standard), Orange and Aqua.




CASE MATERIAL: 316L Stainless steel marine grade available in either matte DLC coated finish or brushed/bead blasted finish
CASE DIAMETER: 44mm (excluding crown) CASE LENGTH: 52mm
CASE HEIGHT: 15.5mm (case), 16.5mm (including crystal) 
LUG WIDTH: 24mm CROWN DIAMETER: 8mm screwed down custom crown with deep etched logo 
CRYSTAL: 4mm Thick single domed sapphire crystal with anti-reflective coating 
BEZEL: Custom 316L stainless steel bezel with lumed ceramic insert (matt finish) 
DIAL: Custom sandwich dial with lumed markers and numbers
CASEBACK: Custom 316L stainless steel caseback with deep etched logo and machine screw fixings 
LUME: BGW-9 Superluminova lume to bezel insert markers, hour/min.hands and dial 
WATER RESISTANCE: 300m / 1000 feet
MOVEMENT: Japan made Miyota 9015

story:
Short Summary

Anthony Price, Captain of the University of Pennsylvania 1979 Final Four Basketball team, its members, friends and family are partnering to give back to the children of New York and Philadelphia.  Anthony established and incorporated Paying the Price Foundation, a New York based 501(c)3 Non-Profit organization in 2014.  Its mission is to provide opportunities for former college athletes to offer mentoring and guidance to 'At Risk Youth' from urban communities.  Through Indiegogo, 'Paying the Price Foundation' is raising funds to continue conducting 'Basketball Camps and Clinics' and to expand its operations to include additional services.  All contributions are welcome.  Funds will be used to facilitate summer camps and clinics during the 2015 season and to provide for organizational fees and program expansion.
'Paying the Price Foundation, has conducted several successful basketball camps and clinics.  In the Summer of 2013, they hosted their first Annual Summer Basketball Camp in Amityville, New York.  Anthony Sr, his son AJ Price and Jack Agostino, have conducted the camp successfully two years in a row.  AJ was drafted into the National Basketball Association by the Indiana Pacers in 2009.  Jack Agostino, was AJ Prices's basketball coach at Amityville H.S. and ranks fifth all-time in Long Island history as a successful basketball coach.
In 2014 they journeyed to Philadelphia to conduct a basketball clinic for the children of Philadelphia.  Home at his Alma Mater, Anthony partnered with the Netter Center, to provide a fun and enjoyable morning of basketball 'skills and drills' at Pottruck Gymnasium.  The camp ran twice, once at Alumni Weekend and then at Home Coming.  It will repeat in 2015 and there are plans to run the camp every year during those time periods.

 The Impact

Paying the Price Foundation has strong and faithful relationships with former college and professional athletes, who are trusted and respected in their communities.  These athletes have worked tirelessly with and without resources to make a difference in their communities.  Government cutbacks have caused the closing of many neighborhood community centers and eliminated resources that where once available to provide programs and mentoring to neighborhood youth.

Paying the Price Foundation recognizes its obligation and the opportunity to bring together the knowledge and resources of successful professionals from various communities to channel their talents and leadership skills back into these communities.

When former trusted athletes and professionals can return to the communities that raised them and demonstrate a sincere effort to bring both financial and technical resources to address community issues, the impact is unlimited.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to financial support you are encouraged to volunteer your time and participation to support the camp.  We are also in need to have some female basketball players to serve as role models for the female participants and of course a few male coaches who can actually run up and down the court.  We look forward to seeing you this Summer in Amityville and Philadelphia.  


All the Best to you and your Family,

'Paying the Price Foundation'

story:
Filthy Commissions

We are a couple of self-employed artists that stumbled into costuming in the year 2000 and haven't been able to put down the needle and thread ever since! We started making custom works of art for friends a few years after that, slowly broadening out to new people and new interests, and eventually Filthy Commissions was born. We're extremey honored that our favorite hobby has become popular enough to sustain our living, and we've met many great people and had wonderful opportunities as well.

We have won more than thirty awards scattered across the country - and even some internationally - for our custom works of art, and we've had the opportunity to be craftsmanship judges in competitions. We broadened to make clothing for ball jointed dolls and pets, wigs and outfits for drag queens, we host informative panels on how to's and tips, and we've even been in and hosted several fashion shows. Recently we aim to start up our own clothing line, and hope to be able to sell our own imagination to buyers who wish to wear a step above ordinairy. 

All of this creativity happens right out of our tiny, 700sqft, one bedroom apartment. There are tubs of fabric lining our walls, foam heads scattered about, and our sewing machine is right in the middle of our living room floor - on the ground! We are in the process of finally moving into a bigger two bedroom and want to convert an area entirely for Filthy Commissions. We have started things off by purchasing our own domain for a new website, and look forward to being able to make things much more neater and professional! It will be nice to have an area specificaly devoted towards our hobbies and work, and we want to also be able to share our new style with our buyers as well.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Any and all funds raised will go directly into Filthy Commissions. We are in desperate need of a sewing desk so that we don't continue to destroy our posture. We want to invest in a few different sized mannequins to better display our work and fit sizes, along with shelving for the wig stands, storage for all of our supplies, and tuning up/upgrading our machinery. 
We also would love to be able to get more professional supplies to go back to the buyer, such as packaging and display from us to you! We always give several free goodies with purchases, and would love to eventually give out nice hangers, garment bags, foam heads, wig caps, anything and everything the customer could ever imagine to keep their custom outfit looking nice and long lasting.

We have a perfect run of feedback on multiple sites and people really enjoy our work, so this would be nudging us in a forward direction to hopefully grow even bigger and better, and allow us to put our creative little stamp on the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with all of your friends. You never know who has a secret identity to protect their city, and needs a good crime fighting outfit. Or maybe some of their friends are movie makers, and need wardrobes. Or even your family, wanting to dress differently than your surrounding peers and stand out - fashionably, of course.
Like and share us on Facebook! Just click on the links above.

Thank you so much for your support, from our Filthy heart to yours!

story:
FeministApparel.com is a feminist nonprofit e-commerce clothing company. Since launching in December 2013, we have helped spread feminism with over 2,000 shirts sold to supporters of gender equality in 31 countries around the world.

Here at Feminist Apparel, we are of the opinion that the negative connotations of feminism are unwarranted, misinformed, and stem from a present and mainstream culture of dominance; one that does a disservice to women and men alike.

We hold the idea that you can be a feminist if you believe in and act on equality. Men, women, and people who say no to the gender binary are all welcome to the movement. That’s why we create clothing that ranges from XS-5XL, cover issues ranging from street harassment to gender stereotypes, and feature designs from our Feminist Creatives community that give up-and-coming feminist designers an outlet to share their work and get paid for it. There’s no reason that equality should be unpopular. Purchase a t-shirt, tell your friends about it, and in doing so, know that you’re doing a valuable service by calling out sexism in your community and creating an inclusive movement toward equality.

story:
Help a young fashion designer and Parsons MFA candidate create her graduate collection to be shown during the New York Fashion Week.

About Me

My name is Andrea Jiapei Li and I am graduating this year from the MFA in Fashion Design and Society Program at Parsons. Prior to attending Parsons, I completed my undergraduate degree in Fashion Design in Beijing, China and spent months in Rotterdam as an exchange student. Since the beginning of this year, I have been spending days and nights at the studio working on the concept, design and production of my final womenswear collection, which will be presented at Milk Studios at New York Fashion Week on September 6, 2014. 

Concept
I don’t want to just design clothes, but also to tell the stories behind them and convey emotions. My creative process typically evolves around a theme – it tends to be free-flowing hence not constrained by considerations such as current trends. 

Collection

The inspiration of my graduate collection came from a previous project, the goal of which was to define and express ourselves in different ways. This gave me the opportunity to further explore myself both as an individual and as a designer, and inspired me to name my collection “I AM WHAT [I AM]”.

The original fabrics of the collection were purchased in the garment district in New York, but I processed most of them through dying, color spray or bonding to achieve the effects that would best represent the aesthetics and the vision of the collection. 


Donation
Designing a collection could be time consuming and requires a lot of financial resources, especially when the entire collection is made in New York. While I try to rely on myself and help of friends to get as much work done as possible, I have already incurred significant expenses to complete the final collection. From buying fabrics and paint spray, to hiring sewers and getting embroidery works done at specialty shops, any help that I could receive from each of you will go towards these supplies and labor that would be essential for the timely completion of my collection.
I will be forever grateful of any amount of contribution you could make, and in turn would like to offer you my token of appreciation in the form of hand-made objects listed below that share the same elements as my own collection.

Perks





Risk and Challenges
I have been working on the final looks of my womenswear collection. As I work towards the September 6th deadline, which is the date of the fashion show, I will have to face a lot of challenges and obstacles associated with the designing, sewing and styling processes. I will rely on my skills, instinct, passion for fashion design as well as the support of each of you, to overcome the challenges and present the best of my work at the New York Fashion Week.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help spread the word by sharing this via email, Facebook and other social platforms. If you are a photographer, a stylist or a blogger who would like to collaborate on future projects, please reach out to me at lijiapei1@hotmail.com.

story:
"How genius is that?!" -Design Milk

"If MONO reaches its funding goal,
the new age of 3D printed glasses will finally kick in." -3D Printing Industry 

"Affordable, custom-made eyewear available to everyone" -3D Print.com

"Unlike most other eyewear products, MONO glasses are specifically sized to fit your head and face perfectly." -PSKF



You probably don't know, because there is no such a choice, until now.

If clothes and shoes have sizes to choose from, why not glasses?

MONO is a collection of eyewear sets out to bring the perfect-fit and thus enhance wearing comfort by providing the Choice of Size, a fundamental yet long-missing
“feature”, made possible by the latest advancements in 3D printing technology.



We have invented an unique sizing system governing three measurements critical to wearing comfort- the width of front frame, the depth of nose pad and the length of temples. Each measurement is represented by S, M or L indicating Small, Medium and Large, forming a 3 digit code.

This code is your ideal size of frame, even if you switch from one style to another, just like the your ideal size of shoes. 

After the campaign, we will reach out to you arrive the Perfect Size of Frame.
Simply select a Perk and sit back :)



(Left) Conventional frame.  (Right) MONO frame

Conventional glasses frame is composed of many parts, reducing its reliability.
We manage to reduce them to just ONE- there is no screw, no hinge. The whole frame is 3D-printed in one monolithic structure with no assembly required, here comes the collection name MONO. 




The temples are made collapsible by means of a patent-pending "DNA joint" and the material properties of 3D-printed nylon used. They bend in all direction adopting to the slightest difference in face features.

Prototypes in various mechanisms and materials were made to test out the bending performance, wearing comfort, and the look and feel.


(Left) Conventional acetate frame.  (Right) MONO frame

We cut weight by using material of lower density.
This enhances the wearing comfort without compromising the expression  of the rim frame.


The lens can be detached with just a snap thanks to the bend which opens up the frame. They also double as durable nose pads.

Turning MONO from a prescription glasses into sunglasses is effortless, 
reducing the need to travel with two pairs of glasses.

This makes MONO a photo filter in the real life.
Filter the world beyond the lens with a cheerful tint of brown or a sober shade of blue depending on your mood of the day.


Plastic lens are picked for its lightness and shatter resistance.
They provide UV 400 protection, blocking 100% of harmful rays. 



MONO is a statement eyewear for the fashionistas.
Interchange the frames in various colors to match your total look of the day.




We provide 5 styles of frames reinterpreted from classic profiles. 
The designs subtly reveal your sophistication and fit for both casual & formal wear.


M- RC: Rectangular,     M- FV: Ful Vue,     M- RD: Rounded
M-WF: Wayfarer,     M- AV: Aviator 



Mix and match with the frames and lens to create your unique pair of MONO.





 

Though MONO's frame is 3D printed, we do need to meet the minimum order quantities in manufacturing the accessories such as the lens, the case and lens cloth, and to cover various costs on product development, operation and patent applications.

Together, We Can Democratize Custom Made Eyewears!

1) Select a perk on the right hand side to start your order.

2) Continue onto the next page to enter any required shipping fee with
     the "custom" button of "additional gift". Enter shipping information.

3) Complete payment via Paypal or Credit/debit card. 

4) Share our campaign with your friends through social media

Wait for our email to confirm your choices of style, size, color and prescription
information after the camapaign. 

Necessity is the mother of invention, MONO is no exception.

Edmond Wong (right), an architect and designer based in HK, had difficulty in finding a pair of glasses that fits his larger-than-normal head. As a seasoned user of 3D-printing for prototyping architectural models, he see the potential in the technology and thus founded a company to build the next generation of eyewear.  

He teams up with Simon Ling, a registered optician, to make sure the frame and lens are working together to achieve the highest wearing comfort, visual clarity and protection against harmful rays.

The project would not be made possible without the kind support from some awesome people who believe in us in the very first place.

Photographer: The Light Particles
Assisting Designers: Cravis Wong and Ricky Lam
Web Consultant: Jonas Tang
Make-up Artist: Kiki Chiang
Models: James Hoar and Eleaner Davies
Music: bensound.com

How to pick the size/color of my frame/lens?

We will reach out to you after the campaign for all these information.
For the moment, simply pick a perk and help spreading the words.

What size are MONO?

Width of the frame- (S) 128mm (M) 134mm (L) 140mm
Width of the nose pads- (S) 18mm (M) 15mm (L) 12mm
Length of the temples - (S) 90mm (M) 100mm (L) 110mm

We will attach dimensional drawings in the coming email for your easy reference.

How do I find my right size?

Use the measurements of your current glasses as reference and adjust the
dimensions you are not comfortable with.

Are MONO available in prescription lenses?

All our lens are available in prescription.
We will contact you for the prescription information after the campaign.

Does our lens protect your eyes from harmful rays? Are they polarised?

All our lens featured UV400 protection, blocking 100% of harmful rays. 
Yet they are not polarized. 

Please read the FAQ before contacting us.

Backers Enquiries: info@itum.co
Press Enquiries: marketing@itum.co
Business Enquiries: edmondwong@itum.co

#ITUM.CO

Disclaimer: ‘Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.’ (Required by Paypal)
story_txt:
"How genius is that?!" -Design Milk
"If MONO reaches its funding goal, the new age of 3D printed glasses will finally kick in." -3D Printing Industry 

"Affordable, custom-made eyewear available to everyone" -3D Print.com
"Unlike most other eyewear products, MONO glasses are specifically sized to fit your head and face perfectly." -PSKF




You probably don't know, because there is no such a choice, until now.
If clothes and shoes have sizes to choose from, why not glasses?MONO is a collection of eyewear sets out to bring the perfect-fit and thus enhance wearing comfort by providing the Choice of Size, a fundamental yet long-missing“feature”, made possible by the latest advancements in 3D printing technology.



We have invented an unique sizing system governing three measurements critical to wearing comfort- the width of front frame, the depth of nose pad and the length of temples. Each measurement is represented by S, M or L indicating Small, Medium and Large, forming a 3 digit code.
This code is your ideal size of frame, even if you switch from one style to another, just like the your ideal size of shoes. After the campaign, we will reach out to you arrive the Perfect Size of Frame.Simply select a Perk and sit back :)




(Left) Conventional frame.  (Right) MONO frameConventional
glasses frame is composed of many parts, reducing its reliability.We manage to reduce them to just ONE- there is no
screw, no hinge. The whole frame is 3D-printed
in one monolithic structure with no assembly required, here comes the collection name MONO. 









The temples are made collapsible by means of a patent-pending "DNA joint" and the material properties of 3D-printed nylon used. They bend in all direction adopting to the slightest difference in face features.







Prototypes in various mechanisms and materials were made to test out the bending performance, wearing comfort, and the look and feel.



(Left) Conventional acetate frame.  (Right) MONO frame
We cut weight by using material of lower density. This enhances the wearing comfort without compromising the expression  of the rim frame.






The lens can be detached with just a snap thanks to the bend which opens up the frame. They also double as durable nose pads.
Turning MONO from a prescription glasses into sunglasses is effortless, reducing the need to travel with two pairs of glasses.



This makes MONO a photo filter in the real life.Filter the world beyond the lens with a cheerful tint of brown or a sober shade of blue depending on your mood of the day.



Plastic lens are picked for its lightness and shatter resistance. They provide UV 400 protection, blocking 100% of harmful rays. 









MONO is a statement eyewear for the fashionistas. Interchange the frames in various colors to match your total look of the day.





We provide 5 styles of frames reinterpreted from classic profiles. The designs subtly reveal your sophistication and fit for both casual & formal wear.M- RC: Rectangular,     M- FV: Ful Vue,     M- RD: RoundedM-WF: Wayfarer,     M- AV: Aviator 






Mix and match with the frames and lens to create your unique pair of MONO.








 Though MONO's frame is 3D printed, we do need to meet the minimum order quantities in manufacturing the accessories such as the lens, the case and lens cloth, and to cover various costs on product development, operation and patent applications.
Together, We Can Democratize Custom Made Eyewears!
1) Select a perk on the right hand side to start your order.
2) Continue onto the next page to enter any required shipping fee with     the "custom" button of "additional gift". Enter shipping information.
3) Complete payment via Paypal or Credit/debit card. 
4) Share our campaign with your friends through social mediaWait for our email to confirm your choices of style, size, color and prescriptioninformation after the camapaign.

a pair of glasses that fits his larger-than-normal head. As a
seasoned user of 3D-printing
for prototyping

story:
Short Summary

Kirsten Is Turning 40 on May 17th, 2013!!!!!!

This year for my 40th Birthday (in lieu of gifts, money, or well wishes) I'd like to ask all my friends and family to support the EARKY "One for One and One" project by purchasing one of the new EARKY Hats, so that one hat can be donated to a child in need within Alaska. In addition, for every hat purchased one child within rural Alaska will recieve a suicide prevention education (see video). 

For every hat that is purchased, We will donate one hat and teach one child in need.

Behind The Name: 


ERAKY

(Give Every Kid A Reason To Say Yes...To Life and A Brighter Tomorrow)

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Needs: For my 40th birthday, I'd like to be able to sponsor 100-200 hats (with your help) and deliver them to rural Alaskan Children who are in need of warm heads this July/August. In addiiton, for every hat sold, I'd like offer an Alaskan young person with a suicide prevention education, that might save a life. 

The hats are a quality weave made of 100% yak wool and have a full fleece lining. (Yak wool is 15% warmer than Marino Wool and has many of the same positive qualities). The hats are very versatile (once size fits most). In addition, the hats are made in Nepal supporting woman business and rural community development.  

Hats to be delivered By June 30th (Free Shipping)

The Impact

In my 13 years of teaching and living in Alaska, I've noticed a shortage of warm clothing for kids. Hat's keep 80% of your body heat from escaping, so it seems like a great place to start in helping meet a child's basic need of warmth, just a step closer to helping them excel in school and life. 

Also, my teaching career, I've lost 18 of my former students to suicide and I'd like to do something positive to help give every kid a reason to say yes, to life. 

The One to One model has been proven to be a sustainable way to make a positive impact when supporting a cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, Share, Share, Share, Share, Share This Promotion. Please post on your Facebook, Twitter, and Email. Even if your friends don't know me or care that I'm turning 40, maybe they are looking for a cool new hat and a way to make a positive ripple in the world. 

Follow-UP

Everyone who donates will receive a link to the ERAKY  website (in development) where hat drop photos and video will be available.

erAKy Facebook

Thanks for all your help in doing something positive while bringing in my 40th!  

Questions: ERAKYHATS@Gmail.com

story:
IT WAS SUCH A GREAT SUCCESS AND SURPRISE NEWS FOR US. THANKS EVERYONE!!          Please also stay tuned to our page for our upcoming new project

 

We’re using the best materials and components to build an excessively quality and vintage-inspired design watches.

 

 

 Links: Watchuseek, Watchinsider, Fratellowatches, WatchTime

 

We are offering directly via Indiegogo and Kickstarter, we are able to cut out the retail channel, middlemen markups, brand exclusivity/scarcity, and offer a US 149 automatic watch with the most premium materials and vintage-inspired design.

Seriously, try to find a better watch for a better price, and we’ll match it.

 

 

LENVINO Watch Co. was started in 2017 Jan, a group of watch-addicts with the passion and constancy of the traditional watch craftsmanship. We believe that the most timeless and desirable timepiece must be the traditional one. We would like to awaken people’s mind about the core function of a watch, thus create our brands.

 

In 2017 Dec LENVINO Watch Co. launched its first Kickstarter campaign to fund the World’s First Minimalist Design Rectangular Tourbillon Watch. After 40 days on Kickstarter, it raised a total of HK$ 427,860. The result is the most backed tourbillon project on Kickstarter history.  

With the success of the first model, LENVINO Watch Co. returns to Kickstarter and Indiegogo to introduce the new brand for you “LECRONOS”

 

 

“LECRONOS” is inspired by the word of ‘chronometer’, meaning high accuracy and precision. We strive to create authentic timepieces by combining traditional watch craftsmanship and vintage-inspired design concept.  

 

We are a group of watch-addicts who have already worked in the Hong Kong watch industry for over 28 years. We specialized in the design and manufacturing of high quality quartz and automatic watches. We have established good relationships with the world’s leading watch manufacturers specializing in luxury watches for high-end brands that retail for over US$1,000, as well as renowned watch companies in the retail market with over 400 chain stores world-wide.

 

Our ambition is to create our very own brand, which we can share with watch enthusiasts around the globe. Through “LECRONOS”, we are offering high-quality products with unique and exclusive designs comparable to watches at department stores and luxury brands, but at only a fraction of their retail price.

 

We want to share our love for watches with you. But in order to do that, we need more than just having innovative and tradition designs, quality support from a world leading manufacturing partner, and 28 years of industry experience. Your support will be instrumental in helping us achieve our dream, and we are confident you will be impressed with the design, workmanship and value that our watches offer.

 

 

We believe that vintage is timeless. It represents the best of its kind and denotes its high quality from the past. We applied this philosophy in making our watch. We used the most premium materials, traditional craftsmanship and unique design to create this authentic timepiece.

Since we have a huge passion on vintage cars, we curated the ‘Race for Vintage’ collection. Every detail in our racing watch is a nod to the features of classic sports cars. The vintage tachometer featured a dial design at its core, equipped with a reputable Japanese automatic watch movement. Besides, we used an innovative approach to differentiate both the hour-hand and minute-hand. We also offer interchangeable racing style Italian calf leather strap and Milanese strap for you to choose.

 

Initially, LECRONOS “Race for the Vintage collection” will offer you 6 color combinations and 2 new versions to choose from. All watches are equipped with an Automatic japan movement and sapphire crystal.

You will be able to choose the design versions by the survey email within 3 working days

 

Brown & Khaki Version - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with vintage brown color dashboard featured a dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in brushed Khaki tone setup with black racing style Italian calf leather strap / Khaki tone Milanese strap.

 

Green & Silver Version - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with vintage green color dashboard featured a dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in brushed silver tone setup with brown racing style Italian calf leather strap / silver tone Milanese strap.

 

Dark Grey & Silver -Single curved sapphire crystal printed with dark grey color vintage car dashboard featured a dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in polished silver tone setup with brown racing style Italian calf leather strap / silver tone Milanese strap.

 

Black & Silver - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with black color vintage car dashboard featured dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in brushed silver tone setup with dark brown racing style Italian calf leather strap / silver tone Milanese strap.

 

Light Grey & Silver - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with light grey color vintage car dashboard featured dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in polished silver tone setup with navy blue racing style Italian calf leather strap / silver tone Milanese strap.

 

Dark Grey & Khaki - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with dark grey color vintage car dashboard featured dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in polished khaki gold tone setup with dark brown racing style Italian calf leather strap / khaki gold tone Milanese strap.

 

Black & Gold - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with black color vintage car dashboard featured dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in polished rose gold tone setup with black racing style Italian calf leather strap / rose gold tone Milanese strap.

 

All Black - Single curved sapphire crystal printed with black color vintage car dashboard featured dial design coupled with the colored hands and second disc. Circular case with the curved bezel in matt black tone setup with grey racing style Italian calf leather strap / black Milanese strap.

 

You will be able to choose the design version by the survey email within 3 working days

 

 

 The Seiko automatic movement is known to be a reliable and highly accurate automatic movement which is one of the most popular automatic movements for many watch brands. Most notably are Invicta and Seiko SAR collection, who features this calibre in a large range of their automatic watches.  

It is a self-winding mechanical movement, with a hacking function and bi-directional winding system, an accuracy of -20 to +40 seconds a day, power reserve of 40 hours and mechanisms gleam with 24 jewels as it vibrates at 21,600 beats per hour. Seiko NH35A is providing accurate and reliable time-keeping functionality to the “Race for Vintage” collection.

 

The dial finds inspiration in the tachometer of the 70s-80s vintage sports car. To differentiate the design from huge fashion watches that are going out in same, we stripped away all unnecessary elements from the dial, focusing exclusively on the crystal design. The dashboard featured dial design is printed on the inner side of the sapphire crystal.  

 

For the purpose to let the user can read the time (Hour and minute) clearly, we had made a creative approach to the time display. For the human behaviour, people reading the time will look at the outer part of the watch and find the hour then the minute. We printed the outer side to be hours mark and the inner side is minutes and also indicated by two colored hands. The red one is indicated for the minutes and the white one is hours. To improve the motion of the dial, we designed a disc for indicating the seconds.

 

The “Race for Vintage” collection spot a circular case with the curved bezel. The case is enclosed by a single curve sapphire crystal that is known for its excellent scratch-resistant on the front and a screw-down transparent caseback with vintage car wheel’s rim design prints pattern from the rear, allowing you to enjoy every movement of the laser brand marked movement rotor and balance wheel motion.

Viewed from the side, the dome crystal joins the case back flawlessly through a smooth curved surface. The streamlined case is more than just an elegant design feature – it also allows for a slimmer profile.  

The metal parts are made from 316L stainless steel, which translates to greater corrosion resistance and durability in high temperatures.

 

We are offering two kinds of straps for the backer to choose 1. Racing style Italian leather strap and Milanese straps. 

 

Our Racing style interchangeable watch straps are made from genuine Italian calf leather. The strap design is inspired by the racing gloves and punched with patterned holes for styling and cooling. The strap will also come with the polished 316L stainless steel buckles and engraved with our brand name “LECRONOS”. The straps have a width of 20mm x 18mm, a unisex functional length suitable for most customers, and 7 holes for adjustment. The wristband contains a quick release spring bar, so that the straps can be swapped in seconds without the need for special tools.  

They are available in five different colors: (1) Dark Brown, (2) Navy Blue (3) Brown, (4) Black and (5) Grey

 

Our Milanese straps are made from 316L stainless steel and come with an adjustable buckle which can be adjusted for every wrist size and engraved with our brand name “LECRONOS”. If you selected the Milanese straps, the plating color will be same as your watch case color. 

They are available in four different plating colors: (1) Silver, (2) Black, (3) Khaki gold tone, and (4) Rose gold tone.

 

 

Horween Leather Zulu strap (USD 45)  

Horween Leather Company is one of the worlds recognized high quality leather factory in USA, Chicago since 1905. Each of the strap will include a Horween official hot stamping logo to guarantee it is original and authentic.

Each set will free for one set of strap changing tools.

 

Our partnered manufacturer follows strict procedures to ensure the quality of the watches they produce. Generally, those procedures can be divided into three parts: Technical Control Check, Quality Assurance Check and Final Quality Check.

During the Technical Control Check, a watch engineer will ensure the watches are in the safety structure from the technical drawing to predict and avoid the potential risks.

For the Quality Assurance Check, the QA engineer will ensure that the dimensions of each individual component are 100% identical to the technical drawings and that all components pass the QA test, e.g. drop test and movement test.

For the Final Quality Check, the final QC engineer will rigorously test all watches, e.g. through water resistance and plating tests. In order to ensure the watches well functioned, all should pass the 240 hours burn-in test before dispatching the products to customers.

 

 

1. Decide the “perk” you want to go for. Click the pink button that says, "GET THIS PERK."

2. Fill out your shipping information and continue with your payment.

3. You will receive a survey email to select the versions of your watch within 3 days

3. Deliveries should start from November 2018 and can last, according to total quantities backed on Indiegogo.

We will ship the watches worldwide. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable in your region.

 

 We expect to ship the orders from Nov 2018. While we will make every effort to ship your orders on time, we ask for your understanding that slight delays in production may be possible. We will keep you informed of any changes as they arise.

 

 All of our watches will come with a 5-year international warranty. The warranty will cover all parts against manufacturer defects, for which the watch will be repaired or exchanged free of charge.

 

1. Keep your watch wound. Winding keeps the watch working, spreads the lubricants and the accuracy should be best with a fully wound watch.

2. Please avoid any Bumps and Shocks of the watches. Shocks can damage any watch mechanism, scratches to the case or break the mirror. Remember your watch is a mechanical watch consisted of more than hundreds of tiny parts.  

3. Cleaning If your watch has become dirty, the best way to clean it is with a soft damp cloth.  

4. 5ATM Water resistance Diving, showering, bathing, taking a jacuzzi or sauna, or any submersion in water whilst wearing your watch should be avoided.

 The more details of the watches care and maintenance will mark in the instruction manual and come with your selected watches.  

 

Please feel free to contact us at (info@lenvinowatch.com). We will always be here to answer any questions you may have.

 

Risks and challenges

Although we are new on Indiegogo and Kickstarter, we have over 28 years of solid experience in the watchmaking industry. We are aware that our project is complex and that there are always unforeseen issues. However, we are confident that our professional manufacturing partners can help us minimize the potential risks by deploying strict quality controls during the manufacturing process.

Our manufacturers stand ready to begin production. Including the time needed to acquire the necessary parts, assemble the watches and perform all necessary checks, we anticipate that the first batch of orders will be delivered to you in about 4 months’ time from start of production. We will, of course, keep you updated on our progress throughout.

Thank you to everyone who has supported the project from the start and to all our backers.

To differentiate the design from huge fashion watches that are going out in same, we stripped away all unnecessary elements from the dial, focusing exclusively on the crystal design. The dashboard featured dial design is printed on the inner side of the sapphire crystal.   For the purpose to let the user can read the time (Hour and minute) clearly, we had made a creative approach to the time display. For the human behaviour, people reading the time will look at the outer part of the watch and find the hour then the minute. We printed the outer side to be hours mark and the inner side is minutes and also indicated by two colored hands. The red one is indicated for the minutes and the white one is hours. To improve the motion of the dial, we designed a disc for indicating the seconds. The “Race for Vintage” collection spot a circular case with the curved bezel. The case is enclosed by a single curve sapphire crystal that is known for its excellent scratch-resistant on the front and a screw-down transparent caseback with vintage car wheel’s rim design prints pattern from the rear, allowing you to enjoy every movement of the laser brand marked movement rotor and balance wheel motion.Viewed from the side, the dome crystal joins the case back flawlessly through a smooth curved surface. The streamlined case is more than just an elegant design feature – it also allows for a slimmer profile.  The metal parts are made from 316L stainless steel, which translates to greater corrosion resistance and durability in high temperatures. We are offering two kinds of straps for the backer to choose 1. Racing style Italian leather strap and Milanese straps.  Our Racing style interchangeable watch straps are made from genuine Italian calf leather. The strap design is inspired by the racing gloves and punched with patterned holes for styling and cooling. The strap will also come with the polished 316L stainless steel buckles and engraved with our brand name “LECRONOS”. The straps have a width of 20mm x 18mm, a unisex functional length suitable for most customers, and 7 holes for adjustment. The wristband contains a quick release spring bar, so that the straps can be swapped in seconds without the need for special tools.  They are available in five different colors: (1) Dark Brown, (2) Navy Blue (3) Brown, (4) Black and (5) Grey Our Milanese straps are made from 316L stainless steel and come with an adjustable buckle which can be adjusted for every wrist size and engraved with our brand name “LECRONOS”. If you selected the Milanese straps, the plating color will be same as your watch case color. They are available in four different plating colors: (1) Silver, (2) Black, (3) Khaki gold tone, and (4) Rose gold tone.  Horween Leather Zulu strap (USD 45)  Horween Leather Company is one of the worlds recognized high quality leather factory in USA, Chicago since 1905. Each of the strap will include a Horween official hot stamping logo to guarantee it is original and authentic.Each set will free for one set of strap changing tools. Our partnered manufacturer follows strict procedures to ensure the quality of the watches they produce. Generally, those procedures can be divided into three parts: Technical Control Check, Quality Assurance Check and Final Quality Check.During the Technical Control Check, a watch engineer will ensure the watches are in the safety structure from the technical drawing to predict and avoid the potential risks.For the Quality Assurance Check, the QA engineer will ensure that the dimensions of each individual component are 100% identical to the technical drawings and that all components pass the QA test, e.g. drop test and movement test.For the Final Quality Check, the final QC engineer will rigorously test all watches, e.g. through water resistance and plating tests. In order to ensure the watches well functioned, all should pass the 240 hours burn-in test before dispatching the products to customers.  1. Decide the “perk” you want to go for. Click the pink button that says, "GET THIS PERK."2. Fill out your shipping information and continue with your payment.3. You will receive a survey email to select the versions of your watch within 3 days3. Deliveries should start from November 2018 and can last, according to total quantities backed on Indiegogo.We will ship the watches worldwide. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable in your region.  We expect to ship the orders from Nov 2018. While we will make every effort to ship your orders on time, we ask for your understanding that slight delays in production may be possible. We will keep you informed of any changes as they arise.  All of our watches will come with a 5-year international warranty. The warranty will cover all parts against manufacturer defects, for which the watch will be repaired or exchanged free of charge. 1. Keep your watch wound. Winding keeps the watch working, spreads the lubricants and the accuracy should be best with a fully wound watch.2. Please avoid any Bumps and Shocks of the watches. Shocks can damage any watch mechanism, scratches to the case or break the mirror. Remember your watch is a mechanical watch consisted of more than hundreds of tiny parts.  3. Cleaning If your watch has become dirty, the best way to clean it is with a soft damp cloth.  4. 5ATM Water resistance Diving, showering, bathing, taking a jacuzzi or sauna, or any submersion in water whilst wearing your watch should be avoided. The more details of the watches care and maintenance will mark in the instruction manual and come with your selected watches.   Please feel free to contact us at (info@lenvinowatch.com). We will always be here to answer any questions you may have. Risks and challengesAlthough we are new on Indiegogo and Kickstarter, we have over 28 years of solid experience in the watchmaking industry. We are aware that our project is complex and that there are always unforeseen issues. However, we are confident that our professional manufacturing partners can help us minimize the potential risks by deploying strict quality controls during the manufacturing process.Our manufacturers stand ready to begin production. Including the time needed to acquire the necessary parts, assemble the watches and perform all necessary checks, we anticipate that the first batch of orders will be delivered to you in about 4 months’ time from start of production. We will, of course, keep you updated on our progress throughout.Thank you to everyone who has supported the project from the start and to all our backers.

story:
Twelve unique elements for the adventurous and the curious.

Just like you, each element is unique. Over time, each will age in its own particular way, giving you a unique piece of jewellery that can tell as much a story as you.   

Choose from a range of twelve elements to wear from our selection of bracelets. From lightweight aluminium and titanium to heavyweight tungsten, lustrous gold to characterful copper, there's an element for everyone.

Precision machined from solid metals guarantees you a lifetime of use without compromise. You’ll find wearing it comfortable and others will find it intriguing. 

Using solid machined materials, we've curated a range of twelve options, more than any other offering available. 

From precious metals such as gold and rhodium to lesser-known but vital elements such as vanadium and molybdenum, we've collected a series of elements that surround us in everyday life but often don't get the recognition they deserve.

Personalise with a name, date or message to make your element truly unique. Each custom engraving is placed on the opposite side to the periodic symbol. You'll be able to specify your custom engraving in the post campaign survey.

A simple, easy to use mechanism makes the bracelet easy to put on, take off and keeps itsecurely on you at all times.

Available in two sizes,the bracelet draws into itself to create the perfect fit around your wrist.

A classic minimal design let’s you stack up multiple elements without overloading your wrist. 

These pieces will stand the test of time, lasting for years to come, helping you look great every day, as we won’t compromise on quality. 

Each bracelet uses real braided nappa leather. You'll be able to choose your leather option in the post campaign survey.

How do I choose?

For one bracelet: Simply pick your element and back the pledge level that it belongs to. You will then get to specify your element and leather choice in the post campaign survey.

For a whole Tier Pledge: You'll be able to choose three bracelets from the pledge level you back. For example, you could pick one of each element, or choose two coppers and a vanadium, the choice is yours.

For custom pledges: If you'd like elements from across the tiers, a Titanium and a Gold element for example, all you have to do is back one of them and send us a private message to request the extra bracelet. We will then guide you through what to do next.  

What will I receive?  

Iron: 304 Stainless Steel. Stainless steel will not rust like solid iron, but still contains 95% Iron.

Aluminium: 6061 Aluminium. An aerospace alloy comprised of 98% aluminium. Unlike pure aluminium, this alloy has massively increased characteristics, making it much stronger and more scratch resistant.

Chromium:  316 stainless steel. Containing 18% Chromium, this steel has a brilliant shine.

Copper: Solid copper. Pure, unadulterated copper. 

Vanadium: High vanadium steel (grade M4). Usually found inside jet engines or in the production of superconducting magnets.

Molybdenum: High molybdenum steel (grade M1): Almost always alloyed with steel to greatly increase its strength and hardness.

Tungsten: High tungsten steel (grade T15) - With the highest melting point of all metallic elements, tungsten is usually alloyed with steel to improve its stability under high temperatures.

Titanium: Grade 2 Titanium - Unalloyed, pure titanium. Almost half the weight of steel but just as strong.

Silver: Fine silver plated - 99.9% silver and plated to 2.5 microns, which is classed as heavy silver plate and will last a lifetime.

Gold: 24cr gold plated - 99.9% pure gold and and plated to 2.5 microns. This is well above standard gold plating and will likewise last a lifetime.

Palladium: Palladium plated - 99.9% pure, palladium is applied to 2 microns to give a scratch resistant, brilliant shine.

Rhodium: Rhodium plated - 99.9% pure rhodium plating, hypoallergenic and plated to 2 microns.

To find out which size you'll need, simply wrap a piece of string or length of paper around your wrist, mark the point where it meets itself and then measure the length of it using a ruler. This will give you your wrist circumference. Then all you need to do is choose your corresponding size from the info-graphic below. 

Every molecule that forms you contains matter created in the burning forges of countless suns. Life isn’t possible without the stars creating the basic building blocks of every tree, animal and person. Parts of us have existed since the birth of the universe. We think it’s time to recognise what we’re made of and what makes the world around us. 

From the chaos of when these elements are born, we’ve applied precision engineering to temper each one into usable form.   

When a star explodes, matter is ejected in every direction, resulting in a cloud of dust that, over millennia, may go on to form planets. With some exceptions, such as radioactive decay and meteorites, this is where all elements, all matter on Earth comes from.  

When you wear an Element bracelet, you’re acknowledging the universe around you and all that it comprises. You’ll be taking your place among the workings of the stars and atoms, among billions of people and other lifeforms as we hurtle through the vastness of the cosmos. 

As each bracelet is unique, so are you. The chances of another exact configuration of all the atoms and the experiences that make you ‘you’ occurring are practically non-existent. But you do exist, and as you begin to take greater notice of the world around you, so will others notice you, as each bracelet will attract attention from those who are also seeking to know more. 

Your exact atomic make-up is practically impossible to define, and defining who you are can sometimes feel like an impossibility. Personalising your bracelet with a name, date or message can help bring balance if you’re seeking answers or if you want to affirm your place in everything. Perhaps you want to remember a loved one, or reflect on a treasured memory. 

Not all treasure is silver and gold. 

About the Creator - Sean

I originally trained as a design engineer then turned creative consultant back in 2015. Since then I’ve been involved with a few crowdfunding campaigns aiding with the design and implementation of products, as well as consulting for businesses in a spectrum of industries. I’m passionate about getting the details right and I’m not afraid to get stuck in with the making of a new product. Outside of work I’m a keen climber and trail runner (with some of our product photography shot at my favourite bouldering spot :) )  

Our story 

We're a small team of people passionate about everything design. From a design consultancy background we have a strong heritage of getting products made for large industries. After many years of designing products for other people we wanted to pursue some of our own ideas. The Arder and Perrell brand is born from the desire to create something that uses unusual materials that you can’t buy on the high-street. Combining a love of engineering and science, we wanted to play on the simplicity and honesty of the materials we use, then find new ways people can interact with them. 

In this first project we’ve rallied on the pure elements. Making them something more than just a number on a periodic table, forming them into an item that you can touch, wear and fiddle with as you move throughout the wold. 

We’ve turned to the Kickstarter community to help bring this project to life, because we hope to build a brand that people care about and there’s no better way to engage directly with the people that care, than through Kickstarter. With this, we also value your input and would be forever grateful if you can spread the word about our little project, by sharing it with people you think might like it.    

Our goal 

We want to create things that are a bit different, sustainably sourced and value the individual creator. We care about people and the creators of the world so aim to have everything made in the UK by crafts people who are well paid and valued. We believe in bringing small ideas to life that share our love of science and technology so that like minded individuals can interact with science and engineering in a slightly different way.    

Thank you for finding out more about us, if you like what you see please share and let us add something different to the world together.

story:
**PLEASE NOTE THESE 3 IMPORTANT THINGS:  

1. SHIPPING TO USA CUSTOMERS ONLY - Sorry... International orders can be placed via email at by visiting www.herobrand.com 

2. The Indiegogo checkout process does not allow you to indicate item sizes. We will contact you towards the end of the campaign for sizing info.


Hero Brand - The Scoop

Hero Brand is a startup clothing company founded by three friends who are cutting edge sports enthusiasts.  We're skiers, snowboarders, skateboarders, pilots, skydivers, dirt bike riders, surfers and most importantly - fans of people who push their sport to the limits. 

Hero Brand doesn't just represent specific sports that we love, it represents all of the guys and girls, young and old, who live to go big. Those people are out there right now, all over the world, sweating, freezing, and pushing their way to the edge of their comfort zones and beyond. Hero Brand is about living the extreme sports lifestyle.    

We’ve spent the past 18-months locating the right fabrics, suppliers, and artists that we feel meet our quality standards. Our goal is to produce a full line of lifestyle clothing and athletic wear, sponsor sporting events, and the athletes who excel in their sport. This Indiegogo campaign is extremely important to us and will enable us to jumpstart our brand in the next few months.

We want to make more than just T-shirts and hats. Anyone can do that. We want to make your FAVORITE, well-made T-shirts, hats, hoodies, jackets and other outerwear that fits great, looks great, and that actually stands for something.  

What We Need & What You Get

Certain minimum production runs are required in order to cost effectively produce and distribute our products to our customers. Our initial funding goal is $100,000. This goal will allow us to produce our line of tees, hats, hoodies and tanks. This funding will also give us the ability to expand our product line more rapidly than we could ever do without your help.

Contributing to our campaign on Indiegogo will give you the option to pickup our gear before it is available in stores. It's easy! Take a lot a our perk options over to the right. We have cool selection for men and women of all ages and sizes. You can also find images of these perks in our gallery link above. 

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

You'll still get your gear! And we'll still really appreciate all of your support! Not reaching our goal will simply mean we need to start smaller and slower than we had hoped. Bummer dude! But with your help, that won't happen!

The Impact

Your contribution will seriously jumpstart our product line! We want our gear to be available worldwide – to everyone that embodies our brand's core message of "Going Big", venturing into the unknown and innovating sports. 

If we are able to fully achieve the trajectory we envision, Hero will sponsor large and small events everywhere,  promote sports innovation, and continually improve and expand our product lines so you can always look fresh! With your help, even the sky is not necessarily our limit!   

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you cannot purchase our products right now. Not a  problem! You can still help by copying our Indiegogo Campaign link and spreading the word on Twitter, Facebook, or email. Or tag us in an awesome Instagram photo! We love that!

Thank you so much for those who have contributed and thank you for visiting our page!

Your biggest fans,

The Hero Brand Team

story:
Coco & Sebastian | the journey begins

Coco & Sebastian is a new fashion label created by two very good fashion graduate friends who who wished to bring their unique and creative designs into the luxury acessories market, including scarves, kaftans, shawls and sarongs.

Since Sandy and Beena both work long hours in full-time jobs (Sandy in the ridiculously over the top world of fashion pr and Beena as an accessory designer for a big evil fashion corporation!) its difficult for us to raise funds to focus on our project. We desperately need your support.

We have, with a little help from our friends, put together a video to outline the story so far and we'd love you to join us on our journey...

So What Do We Need?

We need exactly $8,000 US dollars to start our commercial production. We already have:

*our ranges designed and samples produced
*strong interest from high profile buyers
*exhibition space secured at Fashion Weeks.

BUT we need funding to get our production live. PLEASE SUPPORT US NOW and you'll get access to a whole array of REWARDS (from luxury scarves to trips to London Fashion Week).

Plus our promise to keep you updated with our journey via video updates on our facebook page: facebook.com/cocoandsebastian 

ALL funds will be allocated to production.


What Will YOUR Support Mean?

For our label your support is the difference between life and death. Its that simple.

Without production all of our buyer interest cannot be fulfilled. In addition we will have no product to showcase at Fashion Weeks. So SUPPORT US NOW ;)

Of course funds are our priority and feel free to donate any amount. If its not possible but you like our video and perhaps know someone who will like our product- spread the word. Share the links, add us on facebook - write to us!  We'll always love to here from you  ;)

Thanks for watching!

Sandy & Beena

story:
Frequently Asked Questions

How do I choose which pair of sunglasses I want?

Simply take a look at the four different styles of polarized sunglasses we offer and select the corresponding "perk" on the right hand side.

How do I choose if I want more than one pair?

Select the "perk" on the right hand side that says "Choose Any 2 Pairs" or "Choose Any 3 Pairs"...at the end of the campaign you can indicate which pairs you'd like.

Do you ship internationally?  

Unfortunately, we are unable to offer international shipping at this time.

Can Rx lenses be put in these sunglasses frames?

This depends on your individual prescription specifications.  You will have to check with your local optometrist office.

What are these frames made of?

There are two frames made out of stainless steel and 2 made out of acetate plastic.

 


Who Are We?

We're on a mission to sell great eyeglasses and do good for the world at the same time.  
Every contribution and every pair sold helps bring warm clothing to those in need in the greater Boston area.  

For every pair of polarized sunglasses purchased through this campaign, we will donate a brand new pair of clothing to Second Chances in Somerville, MA. 



The More You Buy, The More You Help!

A PERK IS OFFERED FOR EVERY CONTRIBUTION LEVEL:

$10: Receive a hard, durable eyeglasses case

$49: Choose your pair of Polarized Sunglasses through Indiegogo

$89: Choose any 2 Pairs of Polarized Sunglasses!

$119: Choose any 3 Pairs of Polarized Sunglasses!

$145: Get all 4 Pairs of Polarized Sunglasses!! (Best Offer)


Choose Your Style!

Boylston


Copley

Porter


Traveler



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get out and spread the word about our campaign
  • Tell a friend, co-worker, family, and others about our project!
  • Share using the Indiegogo share tools!

Simply take a look at the four different styles of polarized sunglasses we offer and select the corresponding "perk" on the right hand side.
How do I choose if I want more than one pair?
Select the "perk" on the right hand side that says "Choose Any 2 Pairs" or "Choose Any 3 Pairs"...at the end of the campaign you can indicate which pairs you'd like.
Do you ship internationally?  Unfortunately, we are unable to offer international shipping at this time.

story:
Hi, my name is Miriam and I am the
designer behind the label "Prose".

We need your support to take Prose to the next level and to present our new Spring Summer Womenswear Collection 2013 on Catwalk at London Fashion Week September 2012!

We are looking for people who believe in what we do and who believe that Prose has potential and who would like to accompany us within the next 5 months and follow the collection process until the final showdown on catwalk.

The Impact

To enlarge and to strengthen our brand awareness we
need to be present on a constant base on platforms like London Fashion Week.
It is essential to show the collection on the catwalk to attract the key magazines and the key buyers, to enlarge customer base and to increase sales.
We want to make "Prose" well known for its sophisticated, sensual and smart high-end womenswear. Therefore we need your help!

About Prose
Prose is a high-end womenswear label. "Prose" because we are trying to tell
little stories with every collection. Our aim is to combine innovation and creativity
with the demand of wearability. For us, quality is paramount, regarding both,
quality of design and innovation as well as the quality in craftsmanship.
Prose is targeted at the sophisticated, cutting edge market.

Awards

Everything started with the Festival International de Mode & Photographie in
Hyéres (France) in 2008. The festival is one of the most renowned fashion competitions in the world.

 

Since then some of PROSE highlights have included:

 

  1. Finalist Becks Fashion Experience in Berlin in 2009,
  2. Finalist Mango Fashion Awards in 2009 in cooperation with Sabine Egler selling selected pieces at Topshop Oxford Circus/ London in 2010 and 2011,           
  3. On /Off Ones to Watch Collective Show at LFW in September 2010,               
  4. Collective Catwalk Show at the “Modefabriek” Amsterdam in 2011.                     
  5. Prose has recently been selected to show the Autumn Winter 2012 Collection at Vauxhall Fashion Scout at LFW.

Where we are
The studio is located in the middle of nowhere in a former leather manufactory, in a small town called Schorndorf next to Stuttgart in Germany. However since the beginning Prose has presented the collections in London and Paris.

Every dollar will flow into the collection production and its catwalk show.

Your financial support is needed in the fields of:
-       Fabric costs, print costs and the sample production of the 25 outfits
        we are currently working on

Show costs in detail:
-       Venue costs
-       Lighting and sound system management and technician
-       Catwalk and rigging
-       Video projection and technician
-       Photographers rostrum
-       Backstage equipment
-       Backstage dressers
-       Hair & make-up product and staff
-       Catering for models and staff
-       Event coordination, management and security
-       Models, model management in the lead up to and during
        the show
-       Complete backstage management and support
-       Choreography
-       Rehearsal (including technical)
-       Technical and logistical support
-       Marketing and promotion to leading buyers and media in order to
         promote the event and the collection.

Without your support the project will not see the light of day! If you liked the video make some noise and tell people about the project. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I will post regular updates, and a confirmed release date within this 30 day period. Please drop me a line about any queries you may have and I will be more than happy to clear things up for you.

 

Thank you!

www.prose-studio.com
