story:
First time on Indiegogo?

1. Decide the “perk” you want to go for. Click the pink button that says, "GET THIS PERK."

2. Fill out your shipping information and continue with your payment.

3. Once the campaign is over you will receive a mail to choose your watch combo, case color, dial color and strap options.

4. We receive your color choices and prepare the orders. 

5. See the planed timeline below for delivery.

**If we don’t reach our funding goal, you will receive your money back. 5-7 days after the campaign ends.

 

We created a 24 hour timepiece built from selected materials - to fit your wrist perfectly.

With a Swiss made Ronda movement - protected by a double dome glass - it helps you keep track of every hour - that’s given to you.

Some of our strap combinations:

Straps for every occasion! It’s very easy to change strap with our quick release system. Store them in our leather travel case. Trendy Milanese strap for everyday use. Classic Italian calf leather for the late-night dinner. Rugged mocha with it’s nice texture that will age beautiful. All watches come with one extra Nato strap for all your adventures.

Choose your watch combination once the campaign is over

There is a special perk for each strap quality. Make sure to get your favorite!

The Story

This project started almost 2 years ago. In the beginning, it was just a discussion between three friends about their common love for watches. Later on, it became more serious and we began to focus on how most part of the watches on today’s market are designed. We had to find a space in the market, something unique. My friend and now business partner, said "Let's do a 24-hour watch!".

When scanning the market, we noticed that there is only a few brands that makes a fully dedicated 24-hour watches. And most of them have too many functions or are designed in a way that makes it hard to actually tell the time.

We started to work on the design and the search for suppliers that could handle it.

After endless meetings and discussions, we landed in a clean design. We also found a supplier that was professional and fully understood our project.

The first samples were produced and tested. The choice of the 24-hour Swiss made movement was great, but we had to work harder on the case design, glass and hands.

Back to the design, "Let's apply some 60's vintage design on the case and glass!". The result became this beautiful double dome glass, curved minute hand and dial Åkerfalk Watch.

We use the best materials and the finish in our price segment. With Apple in mind, we aim super high when it comes to build quality and finish. We now feel that we have found a gape in the market with our First Season Åkerfalk Watch, one unique 24-hour timepiece.

The Team

Rickard Åkerfalk has his background in the invention industry. He has been fascinated by inventions since he was a kid, he loves bringing new inventions to life and making old ones better. He likes problems (yes it does sound crazy), but it’s from the problems that ideas come to life. When we create the Åkerfalk Watch we had a big problem...the lack of time!

We all have our days filled with work, kids, family and friends. Our days just didn´t last long enough. This is of course a very common issue among today’s people, so here's where our creative process began. We wanted to create a watch that slowed down people's stressful life. By making a 24h watch we´ll let them see every hour during the day and night. This slows us down… and hopefully it will slow everyone else down too.

Mikael comes from the fashion industry. He has worked with product development and buying processes from both Europe and the Far East, for more than 15 years. For the past 4 years he´s been working as a self-employed entrepreneur

For the last 10 years back Joakim runs his own marketing and design agency. He has a key role in the design process of the watch and great knowledge about the watch industry.

 

Share:

Help us share our project. The more your share, the bigger is the chance to reach our goal. Simply click the buttons below:

Risks and challenges

Manufacturing watches always comes with different challenges, time factor is one important part in making a great product. We have put in a lot of time in development phase to prevent any problems in the end.

Finding the manufacturer that understand the needs and our product and who is professional and organized have taken some time. After sample process and a lot of communication we feel very safe in the hands of our supplier. We will keep you backers informed during the production process.

All watches ships from Sweden, if you live outside EU you might be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. Sometimes customs can be very slow with handling the import, just have this in mind.

If you have any questions send a mail to: info@akerfalk.se 

Thank You!

Thank you all for taking your time to view this project . We hope that you are as passionate as we are about our unique 24 hour timepiece, make your pledge in order to receive your watch.

We hope that you are as passionate as we are about our unique 24 hour timepiece, make your pledge in order to receive your watch.

story:
Millinery is the art of designing, blocking and trimming head wear using the finest materials. The word millinery was derived from the city of Milan, known for producing beautiful materials.


Hi!  I am Tonya Gross from Tonya Gross Millinery. I am a hat designer, also known as a milliner, based in Chicago, IL.  I produce bespoke, couture and ready-to-wear hats for men and women. I am excited about an opportunity that most small businesses like mine dream of; I have the opportunity to produce and sell my collection of hats through online retailer Zappos.com. This collection will be made in Chicago, IL, USA! 

Recently, I was selected by Zappos.com for its 2013 Emerging Designer Program, a program initiated by Zappos.com employees to promote up-and-coming designers like myself.  In March of 2013, my Tonya Gross Millinery CAPSule Collection for the Zappos.com Emerging Designer Program will be prominently featured by Zappos.com through an online boutique, and through social media and marketing campaigns. I am thrilled for the opportunity to partner with such a prominent online retailer like Zappos.com, and so honored by this distinction. As a fledgling designer, it is the “big break” for which I have worked so hard for many years.  

 

This is a unique venture in that I will produce handmade, ready-to-wear hats for a large volume online retailer that are locally produced and plan to hire and train a talented team drawn from the Chicago fashion industry; I am really proud of this.  But, I need your help to raise the funds to produce my line of handmade hats.

Your contribution to my campaign will allow me to:

  • purchase hat foundation materials & trims to complete a large volume order for Zappos.com
  • initiate a hiring and training program for MITs-- aka Milliners in Training
  • hire this team to assist in fulfilling a large volume order of HANDMADE hats
  • purchase the marketing materials, hat boxes, shipping materials, and ship to the Zappos.com warehouse
  • fulfill the PERKS for this campaign that reflect the best of my Zappos.com collection!

I believe my project is significant for the following reasons:  

  • I will bring US-made quality, hand-finished couture and ready-to-wear head wear to a large, online global marketplace
  • I can increase the number of job opportunities for skilled labor in apparel manufacturing in the Midwest
  • Create training programs and employ a talented pool of skilled individuals that will earn a living wage
  • I will act as a catalyst to restore the tradition of hat manufacturing in Chicago- much like BesBen, Raymond Hudd and Mr John
  • I will successfully fulfill the order and encourage a large online retailer to take a chance on a small business rather than import from a mass-production facility outside of the US

Yes, I tried and failed to make my goal on another crowdfunding site around the holidays-- bad timing on my part.  It was an all or nothing platform; therefore, I have initiated this Indiegogo campaign because the need to fund my collection still exists.  Note:  I did secure a relationship with a shipping vendor that will significantly lower my overhead (and have lowered my goal accordingly.) 

I understand that not everyone can afford to make a contribution.  I ask for your help to FORWARD this campaign on to others who may be able to help.  Please SHARE!  I am thrilled for the opportunity to begin this journey with Zappos.com and to initiate a start-up manufacturing operation that will create jobs in Chicago. I cannot produce this collection without your support.  THANK YOU for viewing this campaign and for your contribution!  

THANK YOU!

tonya

story:
Our Story

While traveling the world I discovered European hosiery. I fell in love with the complex pattens, the variety of colors and the unique ornaments. After years of searching for the same great variety you can find in any Drug Store or Monoprix or small boutique in countries like France, Italy and even Turkey in the States.  I began searching around for the same selection. But, much to my chagrin I couldn't find what I wanted.


After collecting over 300 pairs of tights, hold-ups and stockings, I decided to showcase my hosiery collection on a blog "whomovedmybirkin.blogspot.com." Within a few months, the blog was attracting many interested visitors who often wanted to know where I purchased the hosiery that I focused on in my entries. Soon I decided the next best step was to connect the dots - put the interested parties in touch with the interesting hosiery! Which is what lead me to this project on Indie GO GO, in an effort to start an on-line retail boutique that brings the best hosiery from around the world to stylish, yet bare-legged Americans!


The Impact

I will be launching PEEK in September of 2011. PEEK will specialize in making European styles of hosiery available to an untapped American market. It will also allow me to survey the interests of this market with hope of one day developing my own line!! I believe there are many women out there who share in my frustration when looking for unique pieces of hosiery.


What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise some capital to make my first stock purchases at the upcoming trade expo, Curve NY, in August. I have everything else under control thanks to my loving friends and family who have donated their creative efforts, just need some funds to build inventory. That's where you come in.

  


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that asking to donate money is a lot to ask of people. So if you have any other talents that I can use in building my empire I would be happy to work out a trade!!
story_txt:
Our Story
While traveling the world I discovered European hosiery. I fell in love with the complex pattens, the variety of colors and the unique ornaments. After years of searching for the same great variety you can find in any Drug Store or Monoprix or small boutique in countries like France, Italy and even Turkey in the States.  I began searching around for the same selection. But, much to my chagrin I couldn't find what I wanted. 

After collecting over 300 pairs of tights, hold-ups and stockings, I decided to showcase my hosiery collection on a blog "whomovedmybirkin.blogspot.com." Within a few months, the blog was attracting many interested visitors who often wanted to know where I purchased the hosiery that I focused on in my entries. Soon I decided the next best step was to connect the dots - put the interested parties in touch with the interesting hosiery! Which is what lead me to this project on Indie GO GO, in an effort to start an on-line retail boutique that brings the best hosiery from around the world to stylish, yet bare-legged Americans!


The Impact
I will be launching PEEK in September of 2011. PEEK will specialize in making European styles of hosiery available to an untapped American market. It will also allow me to survey the interests of this market with hope of one day developing my own line!! I believe there are many women out there who share in my frustration when looking for unique pieces of hosiery. 


What We Need & What You Get
I need to raise some capital to make my first stock purchases at the upcoming trade expo, Curve NY, in August. I have everything else under control thanks to my loving friends and family who have donated their creative efforts, just need some funds to build inventory. That's where you come in.
  


Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that asking to donate money is a lot to ask of people. So if you have any other talents that I can use in building my empire I would be happy to work out a trade!!

story:
A Brief History

Hi, I'm Connally McDougall and I'm a Canadian designer from the west coast currently based in London, UK. I grew up in Mittersill, Austria and Budapest, Hungary, while my parents served as missionaries. I learned to sew from my grandmother and then from older craftswomen in the towns where I lived.  From an early age, I was blessed to see how much time and work go into making one garment. My exposure to global cultures and a deliberate way of dressing make me acutely aware of the damage disposable clothing makes on the environment and society. It's better to buy one piece of outstanding quality than dozens of cheaper things that will fall apart. My education at Central Saint Martins has given me a solid foothold to launch my line.  Using architectural silhouettes and rich details, I design for confident international women. Colour, texture and quality are fundamental for me. My work celebrates the curvature and angularity of the human body. Balancing geometry and the cerebral side of design with instinct and passion is the goal. My perspective is to show not just a woman's beauty, but also her intellect, determination and strength. The long term vision is to have a fashion house that celebrates global traditions but also employs women in indigenous contexts for their artistic craft in beading, leathers, painted silks, etc and advocating fair and equitable wages. As the fashion industry continues to grow, it's important to have each stakeholder’s voice heard. 

The Project

*UPDATE:

After my successful show in Vancouver Fashion Week, I have been invited to show my collection, plus 8 additional looks at PLITZS New York Fashion Week China, held in Beijing June 13-20th 2014! This is a huge platform to show the only ethically produced collection out of 36 selected designers in a massive, internationally attended show. I will need to raise an additional $6000 to cover the costs of flights to Beijing, accommodations and registration at the show. The $4500 registration fee includes models, styling, meals and also photography and video sessions.

This spring, Niche Magazine  selected me to present a collection at Vancouver Fashion Week (VFW) and generously provided ten models, hair & makeup, lighting, and media as well as showcased me as their sponsored emerging designer at the opening gala. It was an incredible opportunity and springboard for further growth and success in the global fashion industry. 

What I Need

I'm looking to raise $9000 which will go towards:

-Airfare and transportation to and around Beijing

-Accommodations in Beijing

-Registration, modelling, styling, photography and video fees

-Additional fabrics to construct the remaining 8 outfits for the show in Beijing

-Airfare and transportation to and around Vancouver

-Accommodations in Vancouver

-Materials to produce the collection

Generally, the budget for a Fall/Winter collection starts at $5000, but since I am making everything by hand and have limited resources, it will be a challenge and an adventure to see how much I can wow the audience of buyers, retailers and the media with a smaller budget. 

The Impact

This opportunity will be a chance to send a strong message to the fashion industry that the world is not only ready for excellent ethical fashion, we deserve nothing less. We are all connected and the clothing we wear  tells not just our story, but also of those who made it. All of the materials I use are responsibly produced and manufactured which is hugely important in the fast-paced fashion world. Every contribution makes a difference.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Feel free to share my story and this campaign around to your friends, family, colleagues and on social media.

Shop responsibly! Make an effort to buy quality clothing made responsibly, or buy vintage. If you wouldn't want to work in a sweatshop, why would you ask someone else to? The cost of cheap, disposable clothing is much higher than the price tag.

story:
Former UNGARO Creative Director/Designer dissects the fashion industry in three parts: his story, his design, and his secrets as a "Ghost Designer".

"THERE IS A FASHION TO LIFE"…

ALAKAZIA will document his journey and passion, but most importantly educate! 

de·sign·er noun \di-ˈzī-nər\ : a person who plans how something new will look and be made : a person who creates and often produces a new product, style, etc.

ALAKAZIA here! For over three decades now, I have masterfully created designs for successful labels such as Ungaro, Jean Patou, Celine, Valentino, Yves Saint Laurent and Givenchy. In addition I’ve created wonders for Nordstrom, Bloomingdales, Macys, Target, Kohl’s, Wal-Mart, and QVC. My experience ranges from Budget to Haute Couture, as fabulosity sees no price point. My talents have taken me all over the world, living my fashion dream. The passion, power and talent, bound by humility one must possess, to achieve said dream, of being a successful and profitable creative, is beyond defining! Throughout this journey I am always asked, "What does it take to be a successful fashion designer and/or what does it take to be successful in the fashion and retail businesses?" Oft times, there is no one secret retort or concrete answer to those questions, for the locale makes all the difference in the world, teamed with the mindset of your intended goals.  

The purpose of this documentary and funding via Indiegogo, is to “Edutain”, Educate and Entertain, seriously educating future designers, fashion lovers and dream chasers of all ages, backgrounds, handicaps, races, etc. I am a teacher by nature; design happens to be my passion. The combination of these two gifts, allow me to nurture and fuel future creative minds. I have a secret. "My goal everyday is to make twelve people smile or laugh. If I don't think I’ve completed my goal by days end, I’ll call up a friend and say something silly, just to get my dozen smiles or laughs! I want to make millions smile by watching my journey, in hopes to inspire and give them insight into their potential future journey". The initial steps on my fashion journey began as a child, as I watched my mother, a well-known milliner (hat maker) at the time, who designed and created hats for the celebrities, notables, private clientele and retailers of the day. As I watched her, my love for fashion and fine details blossomed. I've traversed through many cities, countries, cultures and worlds to date: designing, facing rejection, traveling, coping with broken promises, learning, health challenges, stalkers, jealousy, triumphs, success, failures and learning the lies and truths of this fashion reality!

"THERE IS, A FASHION TO WHAT WE EAT,  TO HOW WE LIVE AND TO THE CLOTHES WE WEAR"…

I compelled to share with those like-passioned! Hopefully easing, enhancing, educating, evoking, inspiring and evolving those creatives abound……….  Additionally, I will document the full process of conceptualizing, designing, creating, constructing, marketing, selling, producing and branding of the upcoming "Le Chapeau by ALAKAZIA" 2015-16 Collections, inclusive will be the freelance projects for film, theater, videos, weddings, Astor and Kentucky Derby, interiors, furnishings, lighting, branding, merchandising, etc.

With the proper funding, I will answer the hows, wheres and whys of this very personal, challenging and rewarding journey, by documenting my full design and creative experiences worldwide, from the manufacturers of downtown Los Angeles, to the labels of New York, through the Couture Houses and brands of Paris, Italy, London, Asia and beyond! My final visions are to position my brand in Film, Television, a Webisode, Hulu, Amazon, Cable TV and Theater. I will revisit and visit, my past, current and future, with camera crew at the ready, capturing it all! Every step, seam and stitch of the way!

PROJECT CHALLENGES

The initial apparent risk I see first off, is in revisiting the past, locating the companies, peoples and places, for this business is ever-changing and businesses go in-and-out so rapidly. People move on, attitudes change and people pass but their history lives on making it possible, with a harder and more in-depth search, with the growth of the internet and social media we shall prevail! Getting permits may pose a challenge but I am connected in most of the right places worldwide, added with my innate charm, I will have no problem conquering permits! Timing. Having the ability to time my interview requests, for schedules in these industries are always based on deadlines. The timing of the fashion market weeks worldwide, may be somewhat challenging as well, for market weeks overlap seasonally, but I will time this globe trekking journey to the minute. If a challenge arise, my team and myself, will step around and over it and move forward! Getting people to give up the "ghosts" of their past and present, revealing their real truths, may prove to be daunting, for keeping ghosts buried is assuredly how the game is played. Jealousy, envy and egos have always been a vital part of this industry, due to innate talents, knowledge, experience, directness and egos, which by-the-way, will prove to be the ever so needed drama, we all love and desire! Additionally, finding the patience and tolerance of those sharing in my journey, for documentaries take time to tell the clear, honest and true story. Another risk I foresee is the travel, for as we all know, there are social challenges that confront us daily. Other than that, for those of you who know me and those that will get to know me through this piece, you will find that, "I've got this!"

THANK YOU for your $upport!

ALAKAZIA

story:
Here's how you can place your pre-order:

Look at our product range below and decide which product type and colour you like. We will contact you once you've ordered to find out which colour product you wish to have. All orders placed after 1 November 2015 shall be delivered in early January! 

You can choose to 'contribute' to our campaign, which means that you will donate an amount without ordering any product. Therefore, if you wish to order something specific and not just donate an amount, you will need to add a 'perk' when you click on 'contribute'.  The 'perk' or 'reward' is a KARIGAR product (stole, cape, shawl, cushion cover, plaid, etc). 

You can always mail us at info@karigar.nl if you need more information or help!

Let’s tell you about ourselves

KARIGAR (meaning ‘artisan’ in Hindi) is a brand of textile products for the global conscious consumer. Through our Home and Fashion range, we showcase the skills, craft and heritage of rural artisans, using contemporary design.

At KARIGAR we respect nature as much as the people we work with, and so we use natural materials (wild forest silk, nettle, wool, cotton) to create our products. We currently work with highly skilled, rural artisans from villages across North and South India to co-create textile products for the international market.

Our frequent travels to India allow us to meet inspiring and talented artisans – we identify craft groups, train them on new designs and skills and provide them with regular work, which gives them a steady source of income.

OUR REWARDS:

Choose from our many rewards to treat yourself to a beautifully designed, finely crafted product, while making a difference to the lives of our artisans.

You can also gift your loved one something they will remember forever! 
Pre-order your KARIGAR product now to impact lives and #wearsharethebeauty!

____________________________________________________________________________  Impact a 'karigar' €25,-

Sponsor the health insurance for one of our weavers or help educate a child of an artisan through this reward. Your donation will make a big difference!

ORDER NOW

____________________________________________________________________________ 

Cushion Cover Wool €59,- Click here to view larger image of these products

ORDER NOW

____________________________________________________________________________ 


For The Man Who Cares €69,-  Click here to view the larger image of these products

ORDER NOW

____________________________________________________________________________

Cushion Cover Embroidery €79,- Click here to view larger image of these products

ORDER NOW 

____________________________________________________________________________

Stole Wool/Silk €99,-  Click here to view the larger image of these products

ORDER NOW

___________________________________________________________________________ 

Shawl Wool €119,- Click here to view the larger image of these products

ORDER NOW

 ___________________________________________________________________________ 


Cape Wool €129,- Click here to view the larger image of these products


ORDER NOW

___________________________________________________________________________ 

Boutique Deal €250,-


ORDER NOW

___________________________________________________________________________ 

Be Surprised €400,-

ORDER NOW 

___________________________________________________________________________ 

Customised Shawl / Cape (2 pieces) or Stole (3 pieces) €500,-

ORDER NOW

___________________________________________________________________________ 

So why India?

India’s rich textile heritage makes it the ideal playground for us to build on a handmade design collection.

And since two of KARIGAR’S partners are Indians by birth and the third is an Indian at heart, our journey started here – showcasing some of the best craft that its people have to offer.

We are a young brand, having launched only in October 2014 at Dutch Design Week (Netherlands), and we’ve already seen the impact of our handcrafted, contemporary products – loved and handled with care both by the people who buy, and those who create them. KARIGAR is retailing in the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium and UK. And we need you to grow this brand globally!

Design innovation

Tangram Textiles is the design concept for the KARIGAR collection. Patterns for weaving and embroidery are inspired by geometrical shapes of the ancient Tangram puzzle in an endless play of abstract decorations.

This play is also how we approaches our collaboration with artisans – matching form, material, colour, handwork, ancient traditions and contemporary designs. We are driven by the belief that whole is greater than the sum of its parts – and just like pieces of a puzzle come together to form a complete picture, we too collaborate with artisans and our clients to create beautiful products. And by purchasing a KARIGAR product, conscious consumers acknowledge and embrace the unique beauty of craftsmanship and help complete the puzzle.

Taa-daa! We present you the Talking Tag

Imagine if your wardrobe could speak. What do you think would it say? Would it tell you about mass produced clothes or would it speak about garments where the makers gave it unique attention to detail?

Imagine if you could find out about the exact materials that were used to create your garments? About who made it, how long it took to make, where was it made and the technique used? More importantly, would that be something you want to know?

As creators of beautiful textile products, we want to empower consumers and retailers by making our production process transparent. With the help of simple technology, we make the people in the production chain visible and give you as much information as possible about your product.

In this collection, we introduce the Talking Tag - a hang tag with a unique QR code per product. All you need to do is scan the code with your smartphone (you need to download any QR code reader app) to find out details of the people who’ve helped give life to your KARIGAR product – for example the name of the people who dyed the yarn, drafted the design and created your scarf. You can also see pictures and videos that will document the creation. 

Each KARIGAR product has its own story that we want you to know and share with your friends and family through your social media.


The big picture

Our campaign is the first step to make a difference on a global scale. We want to make people in different parts of the world aware of our brand, our beautiful products and the capabilities of the people creating them.

Platform: Our vision is to build a platform of expert, local artisans around the world, where their traditional skills are translated into ethical, sustainable, high fashion products for a conscious consumer like you.

Design and Quality: Most rural craftsmen have a small marketplace for their ethnic products. They sell locally and by making the same product over and over again they unknowingly limit themselves in what they can create. By exposing them to new designs and re-training them, getting them to push their own creative boundaries and in improving their quality standards, we give their skills a much-needed boost and open up a world of possibilities.

Use of technology: For many artisans in remote villages, the full capability of technology remains limited. By linking technology with design and craft, we connect you to our karigars (artisans) and our products, with the click of a button. Already, the chief artisan whom we interact with daily has been given a smartphone by us. This allows us to stay in touch and updated with what's happening on the production site. In the future, we wish to create an app whereby each of these artisans will record and document each stage of the process that automatically links to our web server.   


The people behind KARIGAR

In the Netherlands: Jolijn Fiddelaers  (left) is the Dutch design brain and spends time in training the artisans on design translation and quality. Kanak Hirani Nautiyal (middle) handles sales and identifies new retailers who wish to add an ethical brand to their store. Sindhu Holla (right) handles production and ensures that the design brief is well executed and the production goes smoothly. All three are based in the Netherlands but travel frequently to India and spend time with the karigars.

In India: We identify and work with skilled rural artisans across villages in India. We look for independent weavers, weaving clusters or groups of artisans who specialise in weaving and embroidery, whom we train and work closely with to co-create textile products. Most of the weavers and embroiders that we work with are women. Working on our designs gives them an opportunity to learn a new skill, become financially independent or send their children to school.

How to be our Ambassador of change

We need €30.000 to achieve the following:

1.  Produce our next KARIGAR collection.

2.  Reach out to new markets (through international trade shows, through our web store).

3.  Help find and train more artisans to join our mission.

You can help us raise that amount by pre-ordering from our rewards suitable for consumers as well as retailers who wish to add an ethical brand to their stores. Additionally, we also offer the opportunity to design a space with made-to-measure textile artworks.

How will we use the funds

By supporting our campaign and helping us reach our funding goal, you impact the lives of the 1,000 karigars that we work with. You not only give them a chance to learn a new skill, but you also help them become financially independent and showcase their craft at a global level.

With €15,000 we will travel to the villages in North and South India to start work on your pre-orders, documenting the story of how they come alive through videos and pictures. Once created, each product will have a Talking Tag, a hang tag with a QR code that you need to simply scan to learn who made your product and how it was made.

With €25,000 we begin the production of Tangram Textiles, our next collection that will be showcased at international trade fairs, where it will receive global attention from retailers. Exploring new markets for our beautiful products and getting more orders will lead to more employment for our karigars (artisans). We will identify 2 new craft groups who will be trained by us to develop new products for the Tangram Textiles collection, and be part of our platform.

With €30,000 we can then launch our Webshop and reach out to global conscious consumers interested in beautifully designed, carefully crafted products.

When you order a KARIGAR product, artisans in remote villages are gainfully employed and earn a fair wage. When our orders multiply, so does their income.

Before you log off

As you will know our karigars, we want them to know you.

1.  Order a KARIGAR product

2.  Take a picture of yourself

3.  Post it on your social media page

4.  Tag #KARIGAR and #wearsharethebeauty!

them with regular work, which gives them a steady source of income.

OUR REWARDS:Choose from our many rewards to treat yourself to a beautifully designed, finely crafted product, while making a difference to the lives of our artisans.You can also gift your loved one something they will remember forever! Pre-order your KARIGAR product now to impact lives and #wearsharethebeauty!____________________________________________________________________________  Impact a 'karigar' €25,-Sponsor the health insurance for one of our weavers or help educate a child of an artisan through this reward. Your donation will make a big difference!ORDER NOW____________________________________________________________________________ Cushion Cover Wool €59,- Click here to view larger image of these productsORDER NOW____________________________________________________________________________ For The Man Who Cares €69,-  Click here to view the larger image of these productsORDER NOW____________________________________________________________________________Cushion Cover Embroidery €79,- Click here to view larger image of these productsORDER NOW ____________________________________________________________________________Stole Wool/Silk €99,-  Click here to view the larger image of these productsORDER NOW___________________________________________________________________________ Shawl Wool €119,- Click here to view the larger image of these productsORDER NOW ___________________________________________________________________________ Cape Wool €129,- Click here to view the larger image of these productsORDER NOW___________________________________________________________________________ Boutique Deal €250,-ORDER NOW___________________________________________________________________________ Be Surprised €400,-
ORDER NOW 
___________________________________________________________________________ 
Customised Shawl / Cape (2 pieces) or Stole (3 pieces) €500,-ORDER NOW___________________________________________________________________________ So why India?
India’s rich textile heritage makes it the ideal playground for
us to build on a handmade design collection.
And since two of KARIGAR’S partners are Indians by birth and the
third is an Indian at heart, our journey started here – showcasing some of the
best craft that its people have to offer.
We are a young brand, having launched only in October 2014 at
Dutch Design Week (Netherlands), and we’ve already seen the impact of our
handcrafted, contemporary products – loved and handled with care both by the
people who buy, and those who create them. KARIGAR is retailing in the
Netherlands, Germany, Belgium and UK. And we need you to grow this brand
globally!
Design innovation
Tangram Textiles is the design concept for the KARIGAR
collection. Patterns for weaving and embroidery are inspired by geometrical
shapes of the ancient Tangram puzzle in an endless play of abstract
decorations.
This play is also how we approaches our collaboration with
artisans – matching form, material, colour, handwork, ancient traditions and
contemporary designs. We are driven by the belief that whole is greater than
the sum of its parts – and just like pieces of a puzzle come together to form a
complete picture, we too collaborate with artisans and our clients to create
beautiful products. And by purchasing a KARIGAR product, conscious consumers
acknowledge and embrace the unique beauty of craftsmanship and help complete
the puzzle.


Taa-daa! We present you the
Talking Tag
Imagine if your wardrobe could
speak. What do you think would it say? Would it tell you about mass produced clothes
or would it speak about garments where the makers gave it unique attention to
detail? 
Imagine if you could find out
about the exact materials that were used to create your garments? About who
made it, how long it took to make, where was it made and the technique used? More
importantly, would that be something you want to know?

As creators of beautiful textile
products, we want to empower consumers and retailers by making our production
process transparent. With the help of simple technology, we make the people in
the production chain visible and give you as much information as possible about
your product. 
In this collection, we introduce the
Talking Tag - a hang tag with a unique QR code per product. All you need to do
is scan the code with your smartphone (you need to download any QR code reader
app) to find out details of the people who’ve helped give life to your KARIGAR
product – for example the name of the people who dyed
the yarn, drafted the design and created your scarf. You can also see pictures and
videos that will document the creation. 
Each KARIGAR product has its own story that we want you to know and share with your friends and family through your social media.


The big picture
Our campaign is the first step to
make a difference on a global scale. We want to
make people in different parts of the world aware of our brand, our beautiful
products and the capabilities of the people creating them.
Platform: Our vision is to build a
platform of expert, local artisans around the world, where their traditional
skills are translated into ethical, sustainable, high fashion products for a
conscious consumer like you.
Design and Quality: Most rural craftsmen have a small
marketplace for their ethnic products. They sell locally and by making the same
product over and over again they unknowingly limit themselves in what they can create. By exposing them
to new designs and re-training them, getting them to push their own creative
boundaries and in improving their quality standards, we give their skills a much-needed
boost and open up a world of possibilities. 
Use of technology: For many artisans in remote
villages, the full capability of technology remains limited. By linking
technology with design and craft, we connect you to our karigars (artisans) and
our products, with the click of a button. Already, the chief artisan whom we interact with daily has been given a smartphone by us. This allows us to stay in touch and updated with what's happening on the production site. In the future, we wish to create an app whereby each of these artisans will record and document each stage of the process that automatically links to our web server.   











The people behind KARIGAR

In the Netherlands: Jolijn Fiddelaers  (left) is the Dutch design
brain and spends time in training the artisans on design translation and
quality. Kanak Hirani Nautiyal (middle) handles sales and identifies new retailers who wish to add an ethical brand to
their store. Sindhu Holla (right) handles production and ensures that the design brief is well executed and the production goes smoothly. All three are based in the Netherlands but travel frequently to
India and spend time with the karigars.



In India: We identify and work with
skilled rural artisans across villages in India. We look for independent
weavers, weaving clusters or groups of artisans who specialise in weaving and
embroidery, whom we train and work closely with to co-create textile products. Most
of the weavers and embroiders that we work with are women. Working on our
designs gives them an opportunity to learn a new skill, become financially
independent or send their children to school. 





How to be our Ambassador of
change
We need €30.000 to achieve the following:

1.  Produce our next KARIGAR collection.
2.  Reach out to new markets (through international trade shows,
through our web store).
3.  Help find and train more artisans to join our mission.

You can help us raise that amount
by pre-ordering from our rewards suitable for consumers as well as retailers who
wish to add an ethical brand to their stores. Additionally, we also offer the
opportunity to design a space with made-to-measure
textile artworks.
How will we use the funds 
By supporting our campaign and
helping us reach our funding goal, you impact the lives of the 1,000 karigars
that we work with. You not only give them a chance to learn a new skill, but
you also help them become financially independent and showcase their craft at a
global level.
With €15,000 we will travel to
the villages in North and South India to start work on your pre-orders, documenting the story of how they come alive through videos and pictures.
Once created, each product will have a Talking
Tag, a hang tag with a QR code that you need to simply scan to learn who
made your product and how it was made. 
With €25,000 we begin the
production of Tangram Textiles, our
next collection that will be showcased at international
trade fairs, where it will
receive global attention from retailers. Exploring new markets for our
beautiful products and getting more orders will lead to more employment for our
karigars (artisans). We will identify 2 new craft groups who will be trained
by us to develop new products for the Tangram Textiles collection, and be part
of our platform.
With €30,000 we can then launch
our Webshop and reach out to global
conscious consumers interested in beautifully designed, carefully crafted
products.
When you order a KARIGAR product,
artisans in remote villages are gainfully employed and earn a fair wage. When
our orders multiply, so does their income.

Before you log off
As you will know our karigars, we
want them to know you. 
1.  Order a KARIGAR product
2.  Take a picture of yourself
3.  Post it on your social media page
4.  Tag #KARIGAR and
#wearsharethebeauty!

story:
The Charleston Garment Manufactory Mission:  Design    Create     Educate

My name is Heather Koonse.  I have been a designer, pattern drafter, and seamstress for the past 7+ years.  I am also the owner and creator of The Rose Knot, a clothing alteration shop. 

    

The Rose Knot has become a hub of creativity so much so that I now spend time helping local clothing designers develop and produce their collections.  My dream is to turn The Rose Knot into a design resource center for local fashion designers to develop, create and produce well-made clothing.  This resource center will be called the Charleston Garment Manufactory.  Many of the designers I currently work with are showing their collections at Charleston Fashion Week, which has become one of the premiere fashion weeks in North America since its founding in 2007.  The Charleston Garment Manufactory will work closely with the already existing foundation of local designers to expand Charleston as a center of creativity, fashion and style, while strengthening community through education.  I will educate future seamstresses and I will educate designers to elevate the quality of their work.   

 

Phase I: The Idea

I would like to take The Rose Knot, a small sewing workroom and turn it into the Charleston Garment Manufactory, an educational center for clothing design and manufacturing.  The dream is to create a resource for fashion designers and individuals to use in developing and producing their clothing.  This resource center would offer the following services:

Design consultations

Pattern drafting

Sample garment construction

Sewing classes and workshops

 

The Impact

There is an obstacle right now for independent designers everywhere.  Independent designers must do everything themselves, from designing the clothes, producing the clothes and then selling the clothes.  Small cities like Charleston, lack the infrastructure needed to support a growing fashion scene.  Currently there is not fashion industry in Charleston, which forces designers to travel far distances to develop their designs.  Another alternative is for designers to own a small company.  This puts stress on their creative resources.  Designers must rely on the fading cottage industry or do everything themselves. Not only will the Charleston Garment Manufactory strengthen the community by creating jobs, but will continue the education of a dying art and help expand Charleston into a center of forward thinking in fashion and style.

 

The Funding

A portion of the money raised from this campaign will be used to renovate a building, located in downtown Charleston.  Some of the funds raised will go towards 2 straight stitch industrial machines, 1 industrial serger sewing machine and professional fabric cutting tools.  Most importantly, a portion of the money will go towards a training program for future seamstresses.  The Charleston Garment Manufactory will employ 3 full time seamstresses, 1 full time pattern drafter and 1 production coordinator. 

 

Phase II: Room to Grow  

Once The Charleston Garment Manufactory is established there will be room to expand.  The ultimate dream is to create a full on manufacturing facility.  This manufacturing facility will specialize in the production of womenâ€™s and children's cut and sew apparel for a larger number of local and regional designers.  The goal is to grow the company to employ 5 full time seamstresses, 1 sample sewer, 2 cutters, 2 pattern drafters, and 1 production coordinator.  The manufacturing facility would offer all of the same services as listed above but would include:

Pattern Grading

Cut and Sew woven apparel

Cut and Sew knit apparel 

 

 

Lets Dream Together

I want to thank you for all of the support I have received during this campaign.  This dream would not become a reality with out the support of each and everyone of you.  If the Charleston Garment Manufactory inspires you, please tell a friend about this project.  I am looking for help of all kinds, whether it by a donation of money, time, or possibly a future employ of the Charleston Garment Manufactory.  Donâ€™t you love the idea of living in a place where you can find clothing designed and made right in your own town?


Music in video Courtesy of

Chris Zabriskie, Ergo Phizmiz & Margita Zalite, Albert Benzler and Fred Van Eps, 

Alastair Cameron, Peter Johnston, Alaclair Ensemble

http://freemusicarchive.org

story:
My Passion for Bicycles

In 2011, I rode my bicycle alone for 5000 miles across the United States. It was a transformative journey in many ways, and I've been addicted to bicycles ever since. 

Read my full story, and interviews with other female cyclists, on my website: www.oliviaround.org

I'm an artist, a cyclist, a woman, an advocate, and a writer. With the launch of my new business (designing beautiful clothing and practical accessories) I get to share all the things I love with you. 

What I Need

Let's face it: launching a business costs a chunk of money up front!  In order to cover the wholesale cost of the clothing and bags, as well as the printing and shipping costs, I'll need $2000. That's where you come in!

Products I Love, That I Would Wear

I wouldn't sell you just anything.  The only merchandise I sell are items that I feel good about: from the texture of the cloth, to where they're made, to how they're printed.  

  • Tshirts - 100% cotton, made in the USA, fine jersey knit. Available in both lime green and sky blue.
  • Tote Bags - 100% organic cotton, made in the USA, sturdy canvas.
  • Both Tshirts and Totes are printed with water-based ink at a small, locally owned and operated shop right here in the Northwest. (You're welcome!)

What's With the Hummingbird?

After interviewing more than a dozen female cyclists from all walks of life, one thing stood out to me: the freedom and pure joy that all these women found in cycling. "It's like flying," several women said. I was inspired to create a small-but-mighty design that embodies the freedom, speed, and adventure that's inherent in riding a bike.  I have so many more designs ideas that I can't wait to share with you, but first I've gotta get this baby (my business) off the ground!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't donate right now.  Here are other ways you can support this project:

  • Make some noise!  Spread the word about this campaign, and I'll be forever grateful.
  • Use Indiegogo share tools to post on social media like Facebook and Twitter.

Thank you for supporting women entrepreneurs like me, and female cyclists everywhere!

story:
Hello traveling lovers,

Have you ever wondered how all those countries which names ending in "-stan" look like?

Where the Silk Road passed by and what made the richness of those places full of exotic smells and flavors?  You don't have the time or the opportunity to do so? Well, we propose to share with you pieces of those mysterious lands from the comfort of your sofa, simply by following our travel stories, photography albums and videos available here during the whole trip!

The Silk Road trip will start in Montenegro (June 5th, 2014), followed by a very short journey through the Balkans (Croatia, Bosnia, Serbia, Kosovo, Bulgaria) and Turkey, and then go by the wind throughout the Caucasus (Armenia, Georgia, Azerbaijan) and Central Asia (Iran, Turkmenistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, Afghanistan, Pakistan, India). From Montenegro to India, we will do our best to accomplish the list of countries above!

If you want to help this trip last longer, please make your contribution by buying our postcards, photos or souvenirs! :)

Our Blog:

                         

                                       livinganomadlife.wordpress.com

Social Network:

     

 

    


Road Map: Silk Road 2014-2015 


Contact: nomadlife.aroundtheworld@gmail.com

Sample of a postcard you can order here:

story:
Greetings Fellow Dreamers: I am BillyABSTRACT  and this is my brand, Abstract Thought; a lifestyle brand that is made up of timeless designs and illustrated thoughts of ambition, cool and social rebellion. Since the birth of Abstract Thought in 2008, we have accomplished a lot and come a long way! Indulge yourself in the journey for a moment if you would: from selling clothes out of the back of an Oldsmobile Delta 88, to Pop-Up shops all throughout our birth city of Philadelphia (USA), trade shows across America, the closing of several wholesale deals with one of the countries largest urban lifestyle retailers; Villa and operating flagship retail locations on South St., in Northern Liberties, and the King of Prussia Mall (all areas that of which make up  Philadelphia’s eclectic and vibrant fashion scene), to now approach yet another milestone; An Abstract Thought flagship store in Los Angeles, the Mecca of Streetwear and Lifestyle Brands!

 

We NEED YOU! For the near 10 years of our brands’ existence, we have valued every customer interaction in realizing that without those who support us, there would be no us! Everything that we have accomplished and every goal we have achieved has been backed by individuals who share in our Abstract Thoughts.

Abstract Thought is built on the principles of challenging the norm, living within purpose, pursuing every dream, being creative, daring and adventurous, and dreaming as if you will Iive forever and living as if every moment is your last. As we stand on those same principles today, we are asking for your help as we take this leap!

 

As a company, it is time for us to really make an impact in the urban lifestyle sector of the market. We feel that by establishing ourselves in the heart of where all the “players” are, Los Angeles (Fairfax District) in conjunction with ramping up our e-commerce platform, we can accomplish just that.

 

 

Diversifying from the norm of crowd-funding campaigns, where you would normally see new and innovative technology or a ground breaking idea, we are ultimately presenting you with our dream and vision in hopes of you playing a huge part in that dream coming true. As with every customer that we have touched over the years, we have done so through our art! For your support, we have prepared several of our Abstract Thoughts as your reward.

 

I wonder what those guys are doing with the money…

 

We are crowd-funding this endeavor to pay for the opening of our LA flagship store and all that it will take to make it a creative Abstract space. In addition to what it will take to acquire the desired space, we have also accounted for what it will take to beautify it, staff the space, properly and effectively promote the space through a fashion publicist, inventory for launch, an e-commerce professional to enhance our web and social presence, production for 2 years and trade show placements.

Your support will enable us to accomplish the successful opening of the Abstract Thought Los Angeles location.

 

Support goes beyond your money…

 

If you like our product offerings and can appreciate our Abstract Thoughts, let someone else know about what we are doing! Be sure to share this campaign on your social media platforms and throughout your network. We appreciate your time and support!

story:
What better way of finding the perfect pair of jeans than making it yourself


Our Story

Jean & Tonic is the first premium denim brand that allows you to be an essential part of the design process of your jeans. We created a friendly online interface that lets you, the customer, design your jeans in 5 simple steps.

Step by Step

Customization Process


Buying standard jeans is a thing of the past. Jean & Tonic is bringing the traditional tailoring experience to the digital world, by allowing customer to personalize their jeans in an e-tailoring platform. 
Have a say in your denim, have a say in the details. All your choice, all for the same price. 

www.jeanandtonic.com


Tell us what you want, we simply deliver



Quality


Custom Made Rewards

In order to keep our production streamlined, we're offering two fits: the skinny, and the slim. 

We will contact you 5 business days after your contribution was made, so you can select your size, shipping information, and the following custom made features:


1. Choose Your Fit


Description:

Tailored fit, five pocket style, zip fly, button closure, sits below waist. 

2. Choose Your Wash



3. Choose Your Finishes


4. Have Your Initials Embroidered



Perks


One (1) Pair

One (1) pair of premium denim jeans with custom features in any fit, color, and size. Free US Shipping. 
$95

Two (2) Pairs

Two (2) pairs of premium denim jeans with custom features in any fit, color, and size. Free US Shipping. 

$170

Three (3) Pairs

Three (3) pairs of premium denim jeans with custom features in any fit, color, and size. Free US Shipping. 

$245

Other Rewards

(Exclusively available on InDemand)

Passport Holder

$25


Toiletry Bag

$35


Apron

$45


Where Are The Jeans Made?

At Jean & Tonic we pride ourselves for promoting ethical working practices throughout our entire supply chain. We work with one of the best denim manufacturers in Colombia. Located in Cali, we travel across the country during production season. Its safe and superior working conditions, fair labor practices, and impeccable quality go hand in hand with our company's core values.

Socially conscious denim, for a socially conscious shopper. 

Our denim is sourced from one of the best denim mills in the world, located in Turkey.


Giving Back

With every pair of jeans you purchase, Jean & Tonic donates a pencil case made out of denim with 4 colored pencils, 2 writing pencils, a rubber, and a sharpener to a child in need. 


Our Current Partner



Save The Children prepares children for future success by providing a strong foundation for their formal education; among other projects of emergency response, child protection, health, nutrition, and livelihood. 
Save The Children is present in 120 countries and has more than 29 years of experience in Colombia. 

Meet the kids in Tumaco, Colombia who will receive your donation.
story_txt:
What better way of finding the perfect pair of jeans than making it yourself
Our Story
Jean & Tonic is the first premium denim brand that allows you to be an essential part of the design process of your jeans. We created a friendly online interface that lets you, the customer, design your jeans in 5 simple steps.


Step by Step

Customization Process


Buying standard jeans is a thing of the past. Jean & Tonic is bringing the traditional tailoring experience to the digital world, by allowing customer to personalize their jeans in an e-tailoring platform. 

Have a say in your denim, have a say in the details. All your choice, all for the same price. 
www.jeanandtonic.com

Tell us what you want, we simply deliver



Quality



Custom Made Rewards
In order to keep our production streamlined, we're offering two fits: the skinny, and the slim. 
We will contact you 5 business days after your contribution was made, so you can select your size, shipping information, and the following custom made features:


1. Choose Your Fit



Description:

Tailored fit, five pocket style, zip fly, button closure, sits below waist. 


2. Choose Your Wash








3. Choose Your Finishes







4. Have Your Initials Embroidered



Perks

One (1) Pair
One (1) pair of premium denim jeans with custom features in any fit, color, and size. Free US Shipping. 
$95


Two (2) Pairs
Two (2) pairs of premium denim jeans with custom features in any fit, color, and size. Free US Shipping. 
$170

Three (3) Pairs
Three (3) pairs of premium denim jeans with custom features in any fit, color, and size. Free US Shipping. 
$245



Other Rewards
(Exclusively available on InDemand)

Passport Holder
$25



Toiletry Bag
$35


Apron
$45





Where Are The Jeans Made?
At Jean & Tonic we pride ourselves for promoting ethical working practices throughout our entire supply chain. We work with one of the best denim manufacturers in Colombia. Located in Cali, we travel across the country during production season. Its safe and superior working conditions, fair labor practices, and impeccable quality go hand in hand with our company's core values.
Socially conscious denim, for a socially conscious shopper. 
Our denim is sourced from one of the best denim mills in the world, located in Turkey.

Giving BackWith every pair of jeans you purchase, Jean & Tonic donates a pencil case made out of denim with 4 colored pencils, 2 writing pencils, a rubber, and a sharpener to a child in need. 






Our Current Partner






Save The Children prepares children for future success by providing a strong foundation for their formal education; among other projects of emergency response, child protection, health, nutrition, and livelihood. 

Save The Children is present in 120 countries and has more than 29 years of experience in Colombia. 


Meet the kids in Tumaco, Colombia who will receive your donation.

story:
Educating oppressed, Dalit children of day laborers in Chennai, India

www.lastcoconut.com       www.catchlife.com   








Pledges---Your pledges are integral to the successful launch of Catch Life and will be used to defray the following expenses:

1. Web Page---Domain purchase & web design fees       $ 4,049

2. Legal Fees --Balance- Patent/Trademark Counsel     $ 7,767

3. Trade Show Display & Registrations fees                       $ 9,350

4. Current product order                                                           $16,334

                                                              Total Needed                   $37,500

Risks & Challenges

Catch Life tee shirts, the softest you will ever feel, are custom crafted--- from super-combing of select cotton, ring-spun yarn woven into soft fabric made yet softer by enzyme and bio-washing. Special fabric and print dyes help preserve and maintain the soft hand fabric feel even over the printed areas. The printed fabric is fashioned by hand into a striking lifestyle garment bearing the distinctive (trademarked and patent-pending) Catch Life over-the-shoulder design connecting the Catch Life logo on the chest to the lifestyle design image on the back of the shirt.

CHALLENGES TO BE SURMOUNTED

Challenge # 1---Quality of Fabrication

     How to Meet the Challenge:

  • Thorough vetting & careful selections of vendors
  • Precise communication of expectations
  • On site factory visits (already undertaken)
  • Mandatory quality inspections prior to shipment of product

Challenge # 2---Building the Catch Life Brand

     How to Meet the Challenge:

  • Identification of Popular Themes (back of shirt and cap)--conduct focus groups and Catch Life contests
  • Vision-shared Celebrity Endorsement (beginning the search)
  • Consideration of name-dropping (back of shirts)
  • Potential licensing IP protected over-the shoulder design---e.g. college sports teams
  • Development of strategic partnership relationships

Challenge # 3---Prevention of IP Infringement (Patents,
Trademarks and Copyrights in place protecting Catch Life, CL and Caught! logos as well as unique over-the-shoulder design concept). Without a license no competitors will be able to connect a logo on the front chest of a shirt over-the-shoulder to a design on the back of the shirt.

     How to Meet the Challenge:

  • Thorough & careful monitoring of the marketplace
  • Defend & Enforce I.P. rights, in court when necessary

story:
​

 

 

 

 

Sweaty feet are one of the most unpleasant things to experience - whether it's the frustration of your foot sliding around in your shoe, or the embarrassment of trying but failing to hide it from friends, family and colleagues.

With SilverSocks, the meshed, moisture wicking grills pull away any sweat away from our feet leaving them dry and happy all day long. 

 

 

We spend on average 70% of our lives with our feet covered, whether we're wearing socks around the home or additionally, shoes outside the home. We live in unnecessary discomfort with socks that don’t work with our feet.

SilverSocks provides you with a premium silky feeling on your feet while stopping other irritants like itchy feet.

 

 

 

Every sock is going to slip down, no matter how tight they're elasticated. It's the effect of gravity as well as the constant movement of the feet which leads to the uncomfortable feeling of bunched up socks under your feet.

With SilverSocks, the inventive placement of the hypoallergenic silicon bars keeps the socks up while comforting your feet, no matter how sensitive they are.

 

Sock manufacturers rarely pay attention to the bottom of your socks. They use the same material as the rest of the sock and don't add any reinforcement to combat the weight of your whole body throughout the day.

The underside of the SilverSocks is reinforced with extra padding to ensure your feet have the necessary cushioning they deserve for the whole day.

 

 

 

 

Most socks are elasticated above the ankle, reducing blood flow. The blood circulation to your feet is incredibly crucial as your whole body weight rests on them, cutting that off could mean a heavy price to pay.

SilverSocks are elasticated in the perfect place, they go below the ankle around the muscles of the feet all while avoiding the major vessels.

 

 

By now you probably think it's normal that your feet get cold when you wrap up warm. This happens because the manufacturer used cheap unnatural materials to make your socks and they trap the sweat and then hold it to your feet and make them freeze.

With the SilverSocks, the sweat is wicked away with the grills and doesn't let your feet get wet. On the other hand, when it's Winter and your feet are wrapped up, they keep the temperature regulated so they don't sweat to begin with and don't end up freezing.

 

 

 

 

The absence of bacteria in the SilverSocks gives rise to many other advantages.

Firstly, since the socks are lined with Pure Silver, it's impossible for bacteria to be anywhere near them. This means your feet are protected against all types of germs.

Secondly, since there is no bacteria which can live on the socks, they can't smell. This is because smelly feet are caused by bacteria feeding on your sweat in a warm, moist environment (e.g your feet when they're in your shoes).

Lastly, since there is no bacteria nor smell, you can wear your socks for much longer. The extra durability of the socks ensures they won't wear down and since the bacterial buildup is the main reason you need to wash your socks, you won't need to wash them for up to a week.

 

 

Space Grey

 


Sapphire Blue


Pitch Black

 


We are a small, up and coming team of designers and engineers focused on reinventing our relationship with the things we wear everyday.

We feel as though we’ve compromised our comfort and health in pursuit of keeping up appearances.

This is why we have designed and perfected our first version of the SilverSocks based on the huge problem that has arisen, as everyone perseveres with garments that ‘just do the job’ over scientifically proven and aesthetically elegant – yet affordable garments.

Our aim is to provide functional, stylish and health-improving attire.

We are on a journey of re-engineering the finer points of the everyday wardrobe – starting out at your feet and working our way to the top.

 

Live Life Better. With BeClothed.

 

Key Features

  • Unisex 
  • No-Show
  • Anti-microbial 
  • Anti-Odour
  • Temperature Modulating
  • High Content Silver Fused


FAQ's

What if I don't know my size?

  • The US and UK sizes are nearly exactly the same so you should select whichever range you fall into. If you don't know your UK, US or EU size then measure your foot at the longest part (from heel to toe) and choose as follows:

  • If it is less than 25cm (10in) choose US/UK: 3-7 (EUR: 34-39)
  • If it is between 25cm (10in) and 29cm (11.5in) choose US/UK: 8-10 (EUR: 40-46)
  • If it is over 29cm (11.5in) choose US/UK: 11-16 (EUR: 47-51)

Who are these socks for?

  • They are Unisex, meaning they’re for everyone! Everyone has two feet and our socks will fit them all.

How much do you charge for shipping?

  • We offer free shipping worldwide. You pay for the item, not for it to be sent to you.

How do you know what colour and size I want?

  • Please select this during the check-out process on Indiegogo.

What kind of materials do you use?

  • We use a blend of high-grade Cotton, with an elastane ring around the top and it’s all lined with Pure Silver (We don’t include the Silicon heel grips in the composition as they are added after the sock is made).

How do I wash my socks?

  • The socks self-clean for up to a week (recommended) but afterwards all you need to do is wash them with a little care and they should be back to perfection. We recommend you: Wash them on: low heat and with similar colours. They won’t lose colour but may absorb colours from other garments. Dry them naturally or with a fan, remember they dry quite quickly so take care if you choose another way.

Are duties and taxes included?

  • Yes. We cover this at our end. You only pay the price of the socks.

I have another question, please help!

  • Please contact support@beclothed.com

 

Shipping Details


We offer Free Tracked Shipping Worldwide. Once your order has been received, the socks will be shipped within 2 weeks (excl. public holidays).

You will then receive a tracking number for DHL eCommerce (or another service if we can make it arrive faster)

 

Refund & Return Policy

Any socks that arrive with any manufacturing faults may be returned and replaced after an investigation has found this to be the case. 

Due to hygiene issues, socks cannot be returned on the basis of 'personal preference'.

story:
Ok, we know what you’re thinking...there are so many teeth whitening products on the market. Great, here’s another one.

To be clear. We are NOT a peroxide whitening product.

HaloSmile is the FIRST of its kind. It is a brush on smile cosmetic that will give you a dramatically whiter smile in just minutes. Say whaaaat?

HaloSmile is the world’s first patented, consumer-applied teeth coating that will make your teeth appear whiter in under 8 minutes.

Our team of experienced scientists, PhDs and,world-renowned scientific advisors have spent over EIGHT years perfecting our teeth whitening technology without using potentially harmful chemicals!

How Does The Science Work?

HaloSmile contains the calcium-based mineral, hydroxyapatite, which occurs naturally in the body.

Your teeth enamel is made of up to 95% hydroxyapatite which means HaloSmile is mimicking your body’s natural chemistry—working with you, not against you.


To date, we have completed over 2,000 applications of our product without a single issue!

Similar to makeup, HaloSmile lasts a day and can be easily reapplied whenever you want!

Don't you already love HaloSmile?

HaloSmile can be self-applied, by someone else or by a dental or cosmetic professional.

Just Dry, Mix and Apply.

Dry your teeth, mix, apply HaloSmile, and wait 2 minutes for it to set. Including set time, it takes less than 8 minutes to achieve a beautiful white smile.

HaloSmile creates a smooth, imperceptible layer on your teeth.

No Peroxide, Bleach, Harsh Chemicals or Animal By-Products.

Within this layer, we have embedded whitening particles that give your teeth a healthy, brighter shine.

That's right, we are the first company to successfully whiten teeth without using any form of hydrogen peroxide.

HaloSmile is a unique formulation that creates a light and tasteless layer over the surface of your teeth—covering stains rather than removing them.

In addition, the coating also prevents staining from coffee, tea, red wine and other foods.

Unlike peroxide based products, It does not change the natural state of your teeth, and is free of bleach and harsh chemicals that can penetrate, harm, cause pain, and interfere with your body’s natural processes.

Your Rewards Menu.

The time is finally here! Back our project today and receive HaloSmile at a special discounted Kickstarter price.

Have questions or want to inquire about HaloSmile? Send us an email at support@halosmile.co.

Don't Waste Your Time And Money!

HaloSmile is affordable and costs a fraction of the price of whitening products on the market. And the results are instant!

Stop spending weeks or even months trying to whiten your teeth. Get HaloSmile and whiten them instantly!

Don't Take Our Word For It.

Just listen to what some folks have to say about our product. :)

But seriously, these ladies are so ecstatic about their first HaloSmile experience they can't stop smiling!

Even men love HaloSmile!

Dentist approved!

We have been working closely with dental professionals to ensure our product exceeds their standards and expectations. We succeeded.

What's In The Box?

The basic HaloSmile Starter Kit contains six treatments. It will take a couple times of applying HaloSmile to get the hang of it.

Each HaloSmile Starter Kit comes with 6 Treatments, 1 Bottle of Liquid Activator, 10 Brushes, 1 Mouthpiece, 2 packs of Cotton Rolls, 1 Instruction Card, 1 bottle of Finishing Touch Top Coat and 1 tube of Removal gel.

  • Liquid Activator - 3 drops is all you need to create our secret formula.
  • Brushes - Just like a nail polish brush, use it to apply it to your teeth. We include a few extras for practice.
  • Cotton Rolls - Saliva is not your friend. Keeping your teeth dry is important for a good application.
  • Mouthpiece - They help you get the hang of applying HaloSmile.
  • Removal gel - Many people just choose to let the coating naturally fade away in a few days. If you prefer, you can use the removal gel to take it off.

How Do You Apply?

HaloSmile provides instant results!

You will notice an immediate and dramatic change as you're applying. Pay close attention to how each tooth turns out. You'll only have a small window to retouch or redo each tooth before it sets.

These easy how-to-steps are the key to keeping your smile smooth and free of brush strokes.

What's In It?

Ingredients: Water, Zinc Oxide, Potassium Tripolyphosphate, PAA Hydrochloride Salt, Hydroxyapatite, Aluminum Oxide, Silicon Dioxide, Sodium Chloride, Boron Trioxide, Manganese (II) Oxide, Potassium Chloride, Potassium Oxide, Potassium Phosphate Monobasic, Sodium Oxide, Sodium Phosphate Dibasic, Titanium Dioxide.

Covered by 17 U.S. and foreign patents. Intellectual property is very important to HaloSmile and strictly enforced.

Please contact support@halosmile.co to discuss HaloSmile’s intellectual property. These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration. This product is not intended to diagnose, cure, or prevent any disease.

Caution: Use only as directed. Do not use if you have any known allergies to any of the ingredients. Discontinue use and ask your dentist or doctor if you experience redness, swelling, or persistent irritation of the gums or mouth. Keep out of reach of children. Store in a cool, dry place.

The Development Story

After years of relentless improvement, we have finally developed a product we are proud to share with the world!

The SafeWhite Team

HaloSmile is the first product from the SafeWhite team.

We have a world class team and board of advisors behind our product.

Ray Shealy - CEO

  • Ray Shealy is a successful operator, investor and board member involved with a number of healthcare and technology-based companies. Ray served as President and CEO at HTP Inc., which was acquired by McKesson’s RelayHealth unit in 2008.

Carlos E. Martinez - Executive Vice President of R&D

  • Carlos E. Martinez worked at The Procter & Gamble Company (P&G) for over 20 years, eventually leading innovation teams globally as Associate Director, R&D. During his tenure at P&G he contributed to the success of many products, including Crest® toothpastes such as Whitening Plus Scope, Crest Vivid White, Crest ProHealth and Scope mouthwash.

Mark Shary - Co-Founder

  • Mark is a founder and investor in several other high-growth, technology-based companies, including Updox, InfoMotion Sports, and hc1.com. Mark was the founder of HUBLink, which became the global leader in hospital systems connectivity and is now the healthcare integration division of Information.

Gary Musso, PhD - Chief Science Officer

  • Dr. Musso has over 25 years of experience in Research and Development, leading Science and Technology projects into successful clinical and commercial products.

Satish Garre, PhD - Principal Scientist

  • Dr. Garre has over 11 years of research experience in the design and synthesis of novel small molecules for application in asymmetric synthesis, drug discovery and biochemistry.

Scott Bridgeman - Co-Founder

  • Scott is a molecular biologist specializing in molecular diagnostic testing, now acting as an executive within the In-Vitro Diagnostic Industry.

Phil Messersmith - Active Advisor

  • Dr. Messersmith is one of our active advisors from the University of California Berkeley. He is a world leader in underwater adhesive and binding technologies.

Delaney Banda - Marketing Coordinator

  • Delaney is a graduate of Ohio University with a Bachelors Degree in Communication where she focused on Organizational Communication, received a minor in Marketing and a certificate in Social Media. Delaney has worked with multiple companies and organizations focusing on social media and marketing. Delaney is focused on taking SafeWhite and their products to the top spot in the teeth whitening industry.

Alex Sheets - Digital Marketing Specialist

  • Alex Sheets is a graduate of Ohio State University with a bachelor’s degree in Marketing and a minor in Entrepreneurship. Alex has worked with a number of DTC consumer goods companies, both big and small, to help increase their digital marketing presence. Alex also has solid experience launching products and working on marketing plans to ensure product success.

Spread the love

Did you enjoy our campaign? Please take a moment to share on Facebook. One click goes a long way!

Follow us on Instagram

 

Risks and challenges

After years of Research and Development, HaloSmile is now ready for the mass market. Since we produce everything in-house we have the capability to quickly address any concerns or questions. Of course, we promise to communicate promptly and frequently to all of our loyal backers.
